name: Ginny Caspar
text: I love the two doctors that I know (Dr Justice & Dr Zeien), the nurses, & the staff. I've been seeing them for about ten years+ and never had a problem other than them switching the phones over a few minutes before closing. Like today, it was 3:55pm and their recording that says that they do not close until 4pm. This was important because it concerns an appointment tomorrow. :-( Other than that one thing that happens on a fairly regular basis, I'm 100% happy with them!  :-)

name: Wanda Evans
text: I don't know if I have ever met a more caring and truly down to earth doctor before in my life.  He is absolutely the best.  You're not just a patient to him, you are in his care and you are family.  You can not go wrong putting your faith in him, he will not disappoint you at all.  He's a Christian family man who has a huge heart to help.  His wife and two daughters are precious as well.  I have known him for many years and seen some of the behind the scenes things he does for his patience, he is one of a kind.  I'm so proud to call him my friend and my doctor.  I definitely put my trust in him.

name: Brittany Wilton Holcomb
text: Dr. Justice is one of the most caring ob/gyn's I've ever met. He listens well and shows compassion towards all of his patients. He is always professional and makes everyone feel welcomed. He is also very informative and able to speak patients in a way that allows them to feel comfortable with their options. The staff is also very helpful and considerate. Dr. Justice has a fantastic practice and I highly recommend him!

name: Holly Taylor
text: Dr. Justice is a fantastic doctor who treats his patients like family. He takes time to talk through his patients’ questions and concerns and thoroughly explains all of their options so that they can make informed decisions about their care. Additionally, all of the office staff are wonderful and make sure patients feel welcomed! I would recommend Dr. J to everyone!

name: Emily Douglas
text: Amazing doctor! He always wants to do what is best for me and my health, and I am never treated like just a number. He delivered both of my babies and my experience was wonderful both times. Highly recommend.

name: Brandy Ross
text: Dr. Justice and his staff are phenomenal. He has always taken exceptional care of me. He goes above and beyond to ensure that all of my concerns are addressed. He is definitely a physician that truly cares for his patients.

name: Julie Waldrep
text: I highly recommend Dr Justice. He has always taken the time to answer all of my questions and really helps me feel informed with my medical care. His office staff is superb. They are always so patient with me. If you are looking for compassionate care, you will find it with Dr. Justice.

name: Dietrich Schaefer
text: Dr. Justice and his staff are amazing. My first pregnancy resulted in a miscarriage. During this time, Dr. Justice and his staff followed up with me several times to see how my husband and I were doing. During my second pregnancy, my husband was having some major health issues, and Dr. Justice and his staff were very thoughtful in the situation and went above and beyond what anyone needed to do for my care and my family. You cannot go wrong choosing Dr. Justice.

name: Sarah Beth Smith
text: Dr. Justice is the best! He delivered my son and made me feel so comfortable and answered all my questions! I could not recommend him more!

name: Jennifer Satterfield
text: Dr . Justice is the best of the best!! He takes amazing care of me and my family. You couldn’t ask for better care, skills and knowledge!

name: Thayane Clissia Seixas Lemes
text: Dr Justice was amazing. I felt totally comfortable with him. He listened to all my complaints and solved them. I absolutely recommend him. I will be back for my next annual check up for sure.

name: Brooke Weeks
text: Dr. Justice has always gone above and beyond for my family! He cared for me throughout my pregnancy and delivery, checked on my family when my husband was hospitalized, and was the only doctor who validated my pain and took me in for surgery to find that my appendix was inflamed. I would use him for all my healthcare needs if he was able. I love Dr. Justice and his staff!

name: Aubrey Ballard
text: Great DO and person. I've known Dr. Justice since he was a resident and he is phenomenal. Highly recommend

name: Jessey Mixon
text: I did not make it back to the Doctor.  I arrived 15 minutes early and was still waiting 40 minutes longer.  I refused to waste my entire morning and notified the front desk receptionist.  She seemed relieved that I told her I could not wait any longer and would have to cancel.  Felt insignificant and that my time was not important.  Found a clinic that seems more personable where I wont feel like a number but a person.

name: Kacie Kirkland
text: Dr Justice is a doctor who takes his time and makes you feel like your concerns are important. He takes time to answer questions and makes you feel like you are more than a number.

name: Jessica Pritchett
text: I have used Dr. Lance Justice for over 6 Years now and I could not be happier! he has been my OB with 2 out of 3 Pregnancies with all being a High-Risk Pregnancy. I cannot imagine not having his support, guidance, and laughter throughout such difficult pregnancies. Dr. Justice actually goes out of his way to make you laugh and treat you like you're family and not just another number. I also can’t brag enough on his staff. He has the most helpful, considerate and sweet staff – from his receptionist LeAnn, to his lab tech Carmen. I even had my yearly checkup last month with his new Nurse Practioner, Katie Giles, and my goodness was she precious! She spent so much time with me in the room discussing the many birth control options that were available and she really listened to my wants and needs. I was hesitant not having my appointment with Dr. Justice but she made me feel so comfortable. I’ll always drive out of my way to continue to go to this office!!

name: Dimple Patterson
text: My daughter and I love Dr. Justice. He has taken amazing care of us, even during my cardiac issues (by checking on me and helping us through the entire ordeal). My daughter is a labor and delivery nurse and she just can’t believe the reviews some people write on reviews. Everyone should expect to wait at any doctors office but especially at the Ob/gyn! She says they have to call them over to the hospital numerous times during the day to deliver babies and see Patients emergently. I can’t imagine anyone being upset about waiting! At the neurologist office we wait 3 hours at least, every time, because he’s the best and he spends so much time with each patient! If you want the best you should be prepared to share them with others (so you might have to wait!) ❤️

name: Haley Gary
text: Could not have been more pleased with my experience with Dr.J. He has delivered both of my babies and is so compassionate and cares so much for his patients.

name: allie cheek
text: Dr. Ellis is the absolute best. She is so warm and kind. You can absolutely tell that she cares about you. She takes the time to remember little details about your life. Her nurse Lauren is awesome too! She is always smiling and so sweet. Every staff member I’ve interacted with at Bham OBGYN has been so friendly and welcoming. Can’t recommend this office enough.

name: Lisa Potter
text: I have been a long time patient of this office and just had my baby 7 months ago. I love the doctor but I can’t tolerate the behavior of one of the staff named Wendy. I’m not sure why this office no longer wants to prescribe Diflucan but not everyone can take the same thing you want to offer and it be the only choice. Wendy was very rude to me with no manners or professionalism. She told me I had two choices and that was to get something over the counter or do a phone consultation and the second one isn’t an option since we are between insurances and then she hung up on me. It’s pretty bad when you have to go through a Teledoc service to get the medicine you know you have always taken and need. Do better.

name: constance mostillo
text: As I lay in bed this morning with my heavy heart and wrenching gut. I am hurt to the core with visit yesterday with my sixteen year old daughter. She has had some issues with her cycle and I took her to see a doctor that I was not familiar with.  I don't understand how a parent can be a parent and have to go through what I have. I was asked by my daughter not to come in and I respectfully understood that request and stayed out. I also had an appointment so when I was out I asked where she was and my nurse pointed me in that direction.  I calmly walked down to where she and the tech were.  I asked for my daughter and the tech says that she is going to get her some water  she's a upset.  I say "Water?" I began to shake knowing what has happened.  I text and call. She answered and I asked to come in. She said no and my hands are tied.  I am asked to sit in the hall as others walked by crying my eyes out. I am told that I have to wait in the main waiting room.  I couldn't bare it so I walked in the hallway crying out to my husband. I am then asked back in so the doctor can try to convince me that I didn't know what is best for my child when I tried to suggest other options. I tried to express how I felt. In return I got a story about his daughter 20 years ago. I was told she's trying to please me.  I had already seen another doctor in that building that I asked questions about how a diet change, supplements, minerals,  and vitamins might be an effective way to help. Yet for this doctor wanting to know what doctor would ever say that.  I understand patient confidence and you were her doctor but I am the one who loves and cares for her on a daily basis. I don't understand how I wasn't even considered. I wasn't unreasonable. I have been a patient in this office for 10 years. And have never felt so belittled in my life. If I could give no stars I would.

name: Jane C
text: Dr Roberts was amazing. He took time to listen to my concerns. The receptionists and the nurses were very friendly. I like the way they organized the patients to ensure a limited number of people in the praxis due to Corona.  Would definitely recommend.

name: Mary Carson Bond
text: I love this place!!!  Dr. Ellis and her nurse are the absolute best and make annual visits a breeze.   The office staff is always welcoming.  They are also taking the best precautions during COVID-19.

name: Sarah Browne
text: If you'd like to feel like you are at the DMV; rushed, spoken rudely to and feeling dismissed by the front staff and the nurses, then this place is for you

name: Abbie Rae
text:
Been using this practice for 4-5 years. Dr. McKee is the best hands down! He delivered my first pregnancy and also my second which was twins. Dr. McKee truly cares about his patients, and has always made me feel comfortable and helped with any problems I have had. I am so thankful for him because due to my high risk pregnancies from hypertension with his guidance and care, I now have 3 beautiful healthy babies and had safe deliveries with all.
The office staff, ultrasound techs, and nurses are all great too! Everyone is so nice and friendly and I’m so glad I chose this practice as my obgyn. Thank you Dr. McKee, office staff, nurses, and ultrasound techs for always making me feel welcomed and comfortable, you all are awesome!

name: Ashley McMillian
text: Dr. Damrich and his staff was very welcoming and professional. I would highly recommend BOBGYN.....

name: Patti Burgener
text: Everyone is so incredibly helpful.  I would highly recommend this practice to all females.  I am such a worry wart, and they have expedited some tests so I would have answers.  Dr. Orso was extremely nice and very knowledgeable!   I am blessed to have found them.

name: Franchesca Colon
text: 50 min wait for a mammogram

name: Rui Zhu
text:
Arrived at 9:30am for an appointment at 10am. Nurse got my vitals at 9:55am and send me back to the front waiting room. It is 10:30am and still waiting..... what's the point of making appointments if not sticking to the time?
Update: got in within 5 min after talked to the front office at around 10:45. Dr. came in within 15min after in the room. The visit is over around 11am.

name: Zahida Hall
text: The BEST OBGYN practice in Birmingham. Every doctor is wonderful and the staff is super friendly. I highly recommend this practice and doctors.

name: Lindsey Hamrick
text: The entire staff was great! I didn't wait more than 10 minutes to be seen. I was very impressed. Dr. Carter and her nurse Kayla were wonderful! I would definitely recommend them.

name: Amanda Hill
text: I've been using this office for 10 years. I love the staff and doctors. I think I've seen all the doctors here through checkups and the birth of my first son 10 yrs ago. For the past 9 months, I've been seeing Dr. Roberts. He delivered my son last Friday. Dr. Roberts is great.

name: A Robin
text: The staff was very nice.  The physician I saw while I was pregnant was disappointing / disengaged.  I am currently looking for a surrogate because I have such a great of a similar experience in the future.

name: A. Loving
text: I was an refferel by a co- worker who assured me Dr. McKee was an amazing and kind man. My experience was horrible. Dr. McKee didnt even look at my records that were transferred  over by my previous doctor and retook the same bloodwork she did . He was very negative and harsh. He looked at me as a another statistics. Another  Black, older, overweight, uneducated pregnant woman. He didnt look at me as a person. He assumed I would develop all these issues throughout my pregnancy ,seems like he just wants to do a cesarean to get more money. Little did he know that I eat healthy and exercise everyday and he was telling me nothing I didnt already know because I do my research which if  he would have actually gotten to know me and actually cared who i was as a person. The best experience i had was the staff and the nurse who did my ultrasound. Such a shame I had to tell my co worker that my experience  was nothing like hers and she was very disappointed and spent the whole day apologizing to me. Now my co worker is high risk pregnancy and overweight. Its funny that she said he never mentioned her being overweight.She was very surprised that he clearly jumped on me about being overweight. The sad part is my coworker is white so that leaves me to feel as if it was because of my race. I will not be returning. I would like to thank all of the staff for their support and kindness it made my visit not a complete loss being that it is my first pregnancy.

name: beth eleanor
text: Parking at St. Vincent's is a nightmare, but that's not the office's fault. I've had only wonderful experiences with my doctor (Dr. Carter) and the staff. They are friendly, timely and helpful if you have any questions. My only qualm would be the fact that each individual doctor's nurse has to make their appointments, and more often than not they aren't around to answer your call right away, but they always get back in a timely manner.

name: Victoria Bearden
text: The doctors are wonderful. However, the billing office will go through extraordinary lengths to get a payment from you. They are rude and they lie. The collection agency will give out your personal information to get in touch with you and then will lie on what the amount they will take. The collection agency was confronted by the business office and lied again. Also, the billing office will mark your chart where you can't be seen regardless of issue, even pregnant. Worst billing office I have ever had to deal with. The afternoon appointments waiting periods are awful too.

name: Ashley Mccaig
text: Reading these reviews, the place seems horrible but I see Dr. Damrich and that man is a sweetheart. I am always very well taken care of and even when he was out of the office and I had to be seen by his partners, they were very kind. Parking is a nightmare but that's the hospital in general.  If you are looking into this practice I would 100/100 recommend David Damrich. He delivered my baby boy and a few of my friends babies and everything was as perfect as child birth can be.

name: Selena Rodriguez
text: Dr. Leigh Wenzel Is The Sweetest! She Made Me Feel Very Comfortable. My First Time Here &’ Had A Great Experience, The Staff Was Very Friendly! I Recommend Dr. Wenzel!

name: Stacy Christensen
text: I absolutely love my Dr.M Christine!  I had a bad experience with an other physician and she restored my faith in the group.  I have seen Dr. Christine for over 3 years now, never had an issue!  I guess it's all in who you choose!

name: Carol Churchill
text: Felt like a car wash. Didn’t listen to any of my concerns or needs, just did the Pap smear and the doctor was proud of how quick the appointment went. I was not impressed that my yearly was so rushed and the doctor was condescending when I asked about different treatments. They only care about pushing numbers here not the actual patient.

name: K C (LakeLover)
text: Loved Dr Davis. All of the staff were so nice and super efficient!

name: Jen Smith
text: Parking is a pain. Christine is nice but always always late. I loved Dr. Ellis. My biggest frustration is that Dr. McKee was on call and delivered my son and yelled at me to shut up while I was giving birth then yelled at my Doula who is also a personal friend. Stay away from that guy.

name: lauren tancock
text: I really don't understand how this place has a low rating. Baffling. The staff has never been anything but kind and courteous to me, they've even taken me back when I arrived to an appointment an hour EARLY (by accident, totally my fault but they were great and didn't make me feel like I was being a inconvenience at all). I'm an OB patient and I see Dr Przybysz who is  the most understanding and calming OB ever! Anything I've wanted or needed they provided to me and they've fit me in when I needed without frustration or judgement. Professional, courteous, and fun- I'm so glad I chose this place to bring my baby into the world!

name: Kelley Crowley
text: The staff is knowledgable and friendly. Dr. Carter and Dr. Roberts are both excellent!

name: Britt Hendrix
text: Terrible. I walked out after 2 hours and no one could figure out how to refund my copay that was collected up front. Ruined my day off. And got nothing done. Never even saw a doctor. Then they told me I'd better stay because I might have cancer. What???

name: Linda stewart
text: I can’t reach the front desk to make an  appointment. I’ve left 2 msgs  and no one has returned my call

name: Katrina Bowie
text: The absolute worst appointment I have ever had with a doctor. I had an appointment at 4:00pm. Dr. Orso tried to cancel my appointment six minutes before I arrived. Once I arrive at my appointment, I met a young lady in the waiting room that mentioned that she had been waiting 45 minutes for her appointment. After I was called back and the usual weight and lab, I was supposed to have a consult with Dr. Orso. He refused to have a consult with me. My entire appointment he kept looking down at his watch saying I have somewhere I have to be. I felt I was a inconvenience. No patient should ever feel this way. Especially for an appointment that has been made for over a month. He should have called and rescheduled my appointment since he was "so busy". Finally, the young lady from the lobby was seen by him, because the doctor she was supposed to see had left for the day.  This will probably get deleted. But this is my truth about Birmingham OBGYN.

name: Tatyana Frazier
text: Was trying to get an appointment for a week, they don’t pick up the phone and don’t call back.

name: Anne Murray
text: Bad. waited 4 mos for an appt. then the dr. spent less then 5 min. with me, tests were done but trying to get the nurse to respond to msgs  regarding results over patient portal was horrible. I will not go back

name: Jamesya Hasan
text: Good luck trying to get an appointment

name: Gregory Nicholas
text: They rock. Great  Dr's

name: Debi
text: Dr. Orso has been my doctor for 33 years.  I cannot say enough good things about his care for me my entire adult life.  His experience is invaluable and I have never felt uncomfortable. I highly recommend him to anyone looking of  a gynecologist.  He is very thorough and professional. His staff is equally great!

name: Melanie Salyers
text: Dr Orso is a very caring doctor.   He listens to the patient and doesn't hurry the patient.

name: Sandy Battles
text: Dr.Orso is the best Dr. I have ever seen. He listened to my concerns and explained everything to me. He ordered blood work And test to ensure my health. I got everything I needed done in his office the same day . So I would not have to miss work with more appointments.  Excellent visit , Dr. and staff. Will always use this office and refer my friends and family.

name: Snow Wilson
text: The Best Ob/GYN in the City! I love Dr. Orso. He listens to you, is thorough, and is a great Doctor. Been my doctor for 15 years.

name: Anita Theart
text: I felt that I was seen and heard by Dr. Orso. I would highly recommed him.

name: Haley Self
text: He has delivered two of my baby's and did a fast and amazing job and I'm hoping he can deliver another

name: Julie Dobbins
text: Nothing but good things to say about this office! Mrs. Johnson was thorough, caring and took the time to listen to my concerns. The office staff were great as well!

name: C Baker
text: You are in and out of there so quickly, and everyone is truly so nice. The nurse practitioner was so thorough and helpful to all my questions, as well as being mindful of my anxiety. I will not go anywhere but here. They truly are the absolute best!!

name: Michelle Wilson
text: Love Dr. Taylor her is the best delivered 3 of my baby's.

name: CJ Childers
text: Best doctor around and love the nurse too. Best place go to

name: Soulise Saint Fleur
text: Dr.Taylor is a good Dr I would definitely recommend him

name: Whitney Beaird
text: Such a wonderful doctor and he is very informative about everything!

name: Mary Suddarth
text: I loved going to Doc. Taylor I hope he is still in the hospital

name: lesley house
text: I had my first child through the Woman's Pavilion 8-1-21 Dr. Emig and staff are the best! I couldn't have asked for better everyone was so kind, genuine and treated me with the utmost care and concern. Dr. Emig is a fantastic doctor, Dr. Glass (as she did my C-section) as well as all the other physicians in the practice. Dr. Walker Pediatrician and all labor and delivery nurses I would recommend to anyone. Thank you!

name: Vanessa Munoz
text: I had my son here & I loved the staff. I recommend for any pregnant woman to come here.

name: Ayana Hendricks
text: I'm a FTM and my labor bar delivery was better than expected. My nurses were awesome during my entire stay. Dr. Glass is the best and I'm glad I chose her to care for me and my baby. I recommend all pregnant women to go to this location for labor and delivery.

name: Britney Johnson
text: literally hate this place. i’ve hated it for years but decided to give it another chance and FULLY regret it. they left a missed call NO voicemail, i call back, they “can’t find any notes on why they called” then i show up the NEXT DAY to my 8:30 appointment that i took off work for and tell me they moved my appointment to 11:45 then can’t tell me how long it’s going to even take. so if you’re a working mom like me then be careful.

name: Lindsay Bigham
text: Recently delivered my daughter here and the nursing staff was amazing. They were all so polite and even had a nurse in the room with me during labor. Loved this place!!!

name: Ranjit Gamara
text: Wonderful staff so polite and even had a nurse in the room with me during labor.we  Loved this place!

name: Clay Elliott
text: The care that my wife received during her pregnancy and while giving birth to our daughter was amazing! The nurses and doctors are top notch! IF we have another child we'll definitely be using them again!! The only gripe I have, as is with all hospitals, is the food wasn't that great and a little pricey. But on a good note, all food delivery services like Crimson2Go, Jimmy John's and Uber eats will all deliver to this location.

name: Leslie Alexander
text: My son had a day surgery hand surgery there. The staff was very nice and accommodating. They went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and meet our needs. My son was actually taken back early for surgery. During the surgery I got phone calls with updates in the room. One nurse offered me some snacks when he was taking a little while to wake up completely. The hospitality was second to none!

name: Kiara Lanier
text: if I can give them no stars I would I called up her to reschedule my appointment and lady hung up in my face.

name: Nanette Dunn
text: Every doctor in the women's Pavilion is great. Each one is caring, sweet, good bedside manners, informative, and will make sure that you leave your appointments feeling comfortable with no concerns.

name: Katie Hamilton
text: Dr Myers is the best. having my 4th child and couldn't have a better doctor looking out for my child heath or mine. I recommend her to all my friends and family.

name: Pamela Anthony
text:
We had a set scheduled induction date by Dr Meyers.  She said they wouldn’t cancel our appointment.

We were called late Thursday evening with a cancellation from the OB department bc they had NO rooms and they were full. To call the next day at 10am.  When we called They had 9 discharges set  for the day and we called 4 more times and those discharges Weren’t  even discharged by 3pm after we’ve called 4-5 times already rooms were still full.  Then at 4:15 Friday afternoon the hospital finally called us back  saying they had rooms but it was too late in the day to induce. We would have to reschedule for Sunday at 630am.
This is beyond ridiculous.   If we have another baby it’ll be somewhere else  bc they act like they don’t care and do not even want to do their jobs.  Smh.

name: Robyn Jordan
text: The labor and delivery staff was awesome!

name: Antoneisha Griffin
text: Extremely long wait times at this office !!! I always wait 2 or more hours.

name: Beth Bailey
text: Malcom Simmons sliced my bladder during a hysterectomy and left me with life long urinary problems. He should not operate on an armadillo.

name: Paige Martinez
text: Dr. Simmons delivered all 3 of my babies via csection. He has always taken great care of me, and made me feel as if I am his favorite patient. Most importantly, I trust Dr Simmons!

name: BAMAZ#1
text: Dr. Simmons has been great! He truly cares and is one happy dr! Lol. 2 healthy babies born under his care.

name: Andrea Littleton
text: Love Dr. Simmons he is great.

name: Kim Stobert
text: Dr. Simmons is the best!!!

name: Heather Bearden
text: This was my first time ever meeting Dr Frederick and she was wonderful. She listened to all of my concerns and made my visit very comfortable. I highly recommend her! Her nurse was also very pleasant!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review!

name: Hannah Bryant
text: My experience with her so far has been great! She’s very patient with me especially when I have to bring my kiddos to my appointments! She answers any questions I may have and she keeps me very informed! I would totally recommend her as your OB! This is my last baby and I’m definitely thankful to have found such an amazing dr to care for me and my baby! Also very thankful for her kindness and her staff is also very polite!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review!

name: Ciara Caldwell
text: Dr. Frederick is a fantastic OBGYN. She is patient, kind, understanding, nonjudgmental, and extremely knowledgeable. I highly recommend her to anybody!

resp.text: We strive for 100% satisfaction, and we love to hear about these positive experiences!

name: Samantha
text: The office staff was very nice and efficient. Dr Frederick was very nice and answered all my questions and I was quickly taken care of and didn’t have to wait at all.

resp.text: We appreciate your positive review!

name: Pamela Boles (Pammie)
text: I absolutely enjoy having Dr. Frederick for my doctor. She did awesome on my surgery last year and has been great at making sure I’m still doing good even now. I highly recommend this doctor. She has a wonderful friendliness to her.

resp.text: We strive for 100% satisfaction, and we love to hear about these positive experiences!

name: Devan Talbot
text: Dr. Frederick is truly the most incredible doctor!! Not only is she genuine and sincerely cares, but she listens and does everything she can to help! I am so thankful for her and would never go to another!☺️

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review!

name: Deborah Miller
text:
I brought my 18 year old daughter to visit the doctor and my daughter wanted me to go back with her and for some reason you have a silly rule that only patients can go back unless the doctor approves. The nurse went back to check to make sure it was OK if I went back when she came back she said the doctor said it was OK but my daughter was in getting a sonogram Because of period Issues. But when My daughter that got back to her room the nurse never come up to the waiting room to get me so I was uninformed on what the doctor said and my daughter is not very reliable about telling me what she had to say. So I am left in the dark.

Then the next month I brought in my 16 year old daughter who was having Irregular periods. And again I was not allowed to go in the room and to even find out what was going on with that situation. Nothing was prescribed all she said was calling if we needed her to make your appointment or at least that’s what my daughter remembers

resp.text: We are always looking for ways to improve; we appreciate your input. If you would be willing, we would like to have you contact our manager at 256-543-3977 to discuss ways we can better serve you in the future.

name: Karee Lacey
text: Dr. Frederick and her staff are so friendly and knowledgeable. I no longer live near her practice and choose to go out of my way just to see her.

resp.text: We really appreciate your feedback!

name: Jo Elliott
text: Dr Fredrick is very easy to talk to. I believe that COVID has helped the office staff. Everything seems to run smoother than it once did. I ‘m excited that they have a portal now that I can use to make appts and see test results

resp.text: We strive for 100% satisfaction, and we love to hear about these positive experiences!

name: amber cockrel
text: I love mrs. Frederick she's one the best doctors and only one I will see.

resp.text: Thank you; we appreciate your feedback!

name: Sabrina Hebert
text: Dr. Frederick is a very good doctor. She takes time to make sure everything is good with you. Asks lots of probing questions in case you are forgetting to address something. She never rushes you

resp.text: We are so happy to read such a great review!

name: Mackie Davis
text: Dr. Frederick is absolutely incredible. She has delivered both of my babies and it was the best experience both times! She’s the best!!!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review!

name: Heather Sutton
text: She is the best OBGYN around!! She listens to my concerns and always spends time with each patient. I am so comfortable around her and she has helped in my regular gynecology and pregnancy visits.

resp.text: We're so glad that we were able to go above and beyond your expectations!

name: TheLadyrider360
text: Great service, friendly staff,  attentive and professional, I was very pleased with my first time experience.

resp.text: We are so happy to read such a great review!

name: Miranda Chambers
text: I was so impressed with Dr Frederick! She was very down-to-earth and very knowledgeable. She answered all my questions!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to the team here!

name: Brittany Harbison
text: Dr. Frederick is so kind and caring! She is definitely the best!

resp.text: We really appreciate your feedback!

name: Robin Kornegay
text: Dr. Frederick is so sweet! She listens to what you have to say. I highly recommend her!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words!

name: AC Haney
text: Dr. Frederick is the best! I’ve been really sick during my pregnancy and she has listened and done everything in her power to help me!

resp.text: We're so glad that we were able to go above and beyond your expectations!

name: Jennie Williams
text: I have tried to get an appointment for a week. The office staff is a joke! I had a referral sent over from my doctor after they refused to make me an appointment without one. Then, I never heard anything when they received my referral. So, I called again and they still will not make my appointment because they want a form filled out that my doctor does not even have. They want me to call and tell my doctor...SMH Why, not call them yourself to insure you haver what you need. Nope, that would mean work for the office staff.. Thinking about just giving up and going somewhere else.

name: Kirsten Holcomb
text: hands down the best OB i have EVER been too. she delivered my son and explained everything throughly, checked on me, and helped me pick a birth control that was right for me. she coached me through labor and breathing. honestly couldn’t have asked for a better person!!❤️

name: Brittanie Wooten
text: She's super sweet! Great experience!!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review!

name: Janice Gray
text: Love Dr Frederick

resp.text: Thank you so much for your positive comments!

name: Kristy Gwin
text: Worst medical experience I have ever had with a doctor and I work with doctors daily. Very catty, refuses to listen to my concerns and is either pushing expensive surgeries or expensive new market medications.

resp.text: Hi Kristy, thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent experience. We are disappointed to hear that you were not satisfied with your visit.

name: Kerstin Kistler
text: I switched to SWC and Dr Cooper after I had a traumatic birth experience at another BHM hospital. Dr Cooper and her staff are lovely and kind. They truly care for their patients and listen.  The midwives are fantastic and when I went through my second pregnancy I felt that I could trust them with my care. I recommend this place to every women who desires to be treated with respect and who wants her voice to be heard. They are very friendly towards natural birthing, breastfeeding and low intervention.

name: Angela Hollis
text: ENT office was nice and clean. Very fast and timely service. Dr. Clark was awesome. He was very thorough.

resp.text: Thanks for the review!

name: JoAnn Flood
text: The doctors are wonderful. Love my doctor. Dr Williams is my Dr. He is a very caring and concern Dr. About your health. I don't like the idea of paying all that money to park when you are there for a doctors appointment. I can understand if you were parking to visit someone. You have to pay copay, pay for medicine and pay to park. There should be free parking for doctors visits or a discount.

resp.text: We're so glad you had a good experience with us! Thanks for your review, JoAnn.

name: Felisha Chism
text: My mother’s physician is Dr. William Kirby. He and the nurse staff are absolutely excellent. Always caring. Always flexible and patient. They are about patient care. I would highly recommend this clinic.

resp.text: Thanks for your review Felisha! We always try our best to give our patients the quality care they deserve. Let us know if we can do anything else for you.

name: Bellalinn
text: Dr. Ballio is a very nice and professional doctor. Staff is always kind and smiling. Just saw a new GYN doctor Ballio sent me to. Her name is Dr. Collins and I found her to be very nice. She addressed everything I spoke of and treated me with dignity. This is so important.

resp.text:
We're glad you had a nice visit with us, Bella!

Thanks for your review too!

name: Brooke Quintero
text: Dr. Cooper is absolutely amazing. She made my second Birth and PP experience The best I could ask for and more. The Nurses are so kind and genuinely love their job and serving you. The midwives are equally amazing and will be right there with you through labor. Best Labor and Delivery in Birmingham. Hands down.

resp.text: Brooke, thank you so much for the positive review.  We wish you and your family the best!

name: Tammy Price
text: Easy in and out .Friendly staff.

name: Aminah Shah
text:
I’ve had great experiences with the doctors from Simon-Williamson clinic that I’ve used: Dr. Tibbetts (pediatrics), Dr. LeCroy (ophthalmology), and Dr. Wood (internal medicine). There were a couple of doctors that have left the clinic but who were also wonderful. I’ve found the staff to be generally very nice and helpful. Parking is a little pricey, but that’s just part of it. It’s not the clinic’s fault.

I’ve signed up for the health records app, and most of my doctors have been very timely in recording results.

Overall, I am a happy client of SWC.

name: ArianaSaré P.
text: This place charged me for someone else's bill; it's been 3 weeks and they still have not refunded the money they owe my husband and I. They are so unprofessional, I do not recommend.

name: Alexcia
text: Worst hospital ever!!!! Dr. William Kirby and his NP Samantha Williams are the most incompetent people in the medical field. They refuse to run necessary test to rule out various health conditions and then when you fight for medical care they dismiss you as a patient. If you want to die this is the place to go. If otherwise go to UAB.

name: Sharrah Gibson
text: I'm originally from Birmingham and I just recently moved back to Birmingham, so I called the Simon-Williamson clinic today to establish care w/ a primary physician.  I think the person I talked to over the phone name was Donna. And one of the 1st things she said to me was "none of our doctors prescribe long term pain medications".  Then she asked me what current medications was I on? Before even really trying to figure out my need I fell like she automatically assumed with her questions and her tone that I was a drug seeking patient with numerous heath concerns.  Even when I told her I'm just new in town, and just wanted to establish care w/ a physician, she still did not listen to me.  She proceeded to tell me that most of the doctors that are accepting new patients will have to receive my medical records and review them 1st before taking me on as a patient.  She told me to go to the website, look at the doctors then call her back.  I've never had this type of customer service before in my life!! 😩😡 I felt like she made so many assumptions w/o discovering my real need.  I'm a healthy 32 year old that just wants to be proactive w/ my health.  You do not only have to go to the doctor when you are sick!!

name: Hannah Miller
text: I made an appointment 2 weeks prior to today and confirmed it with a receptionist over the phone who was not very personable to begin with. I was told how to get here, what floor, what time and even to arrive early. I arrive and the receptionist tells me that she doesn’t even have me scheduled for an appointment yet she took my personal information over the phone! This is ridiculous. She then proceeded to ask if I’d like to schedule an appointment. I did not drive all the way up here to schedule an appointment! I will be finding a new primary care physician. My time, energy, & pto has been wasted today.

name: Josh B
text:
Had a child at Princeton, Dr. E. was assigned to us as a pediatrician while in postpartum.  Dr. E. seemed knowledgeable and friendly in the two times he visited us after the birth. The first time he gave our baby an exam and "tested" his reflexes.  The second time he came by was similar to the first. Together both visits cost $240 and were less than 30min each. In addition to Dr. E's visit we were discharged by Dr. T.  Dr. T. did less than Dr. E. though the visit was similar to the other two.  $100 for less than 30min as per statement.

As a cash paying patient, I would have liked to have been notified of the additional charges ahead of time. In addition, I would have expected a higher quality of care for what i was charged. Overall, one star per Dr and minus three for the unnecessarily expensive and deceptive billing practices.

name: Megan Rowe
text: If 0 Stars was an option I would leave it for the primary care physician staff at this clinic. Appointment times are changed without notification and there is NO patient consideration when it comes to time. The staff is very unhelpful and was refused to be transferred to the patient care representatives by the operator. If you have the ability to use a different clinic I highly recommend it. Birmingham is full of wonderful internal medicine physicians but the staff at this clinic makes the experience negative.

name: Terri Ward
text: I worked there and it was awful. I've never worked with doctor's who didn't care about people, like those there. I worked with Dr. Cotton and she would get mad at me for helping our elderly patients fill out their paperwork.  She would say " if they needed help, they should've brought their family with them". That is just the tip of the iceberg. Most employee's were nice, but I would never want a doctor from there.

name: Google User
text: I love the doctors. They were so good to me during my pregnacy and was willing to answer any questions I had as a new mom. My son sees the peditricion there. The only thing that makes me not wanna go to our appointments is having to pay for the parking. I moved here from another state and I've never had to pay to get out of the parking lot.

name: Debra Parker
text: It was very busy...

name: Albert McWilliams Sr
text: I do not recommend this facility. I don't believe their primary concern is quality healthcare. Many of the staff members are very adversarial, and cavalier in their interactions with patients.

name: Marilyn Evans
text: Leia the operator is at SWC gives very good customer service. I was not having a good day. She made me feel better by being very courteous to me. Thanks Leia.

name: hugh darty
text: Get ready to sit in the waiting room for hours. Came over to pick up a pair of replacement hearing aids and now am 1.5 hours past pickup time and no end in sight. Been trying to get these picked up for two weeks as they have been here that long according to their representatives. Very unorganized. Had a brother in law sit here all day once as they lost his appointment in the system.

name: Charles Pace
text:
Do NOT see Dr James Lindsey. He has been my doctor for 30 years. Liked him better when he had his other nurse, not WENDY... She has screwed up my meds more times than I can count. When my mom was sick with cancer, he told us (the family) that we should leave the hospital room and pull the plug .She lived 4 more months WITHOUT PAIN, thanks to another doctor.   Wendy left me a message, that I still have, telling me that Ambien 10 is going To be discontinued, I contacted the manufacturer. They said they weren't doing any discontinuing.  I called to see about signing a release for my medical records to be sent to another doctor (because he would not fill my diuretic or Ambien) both I had been on for years with no side effects, Wendy called my pharmacist and deactivated all my meds .Thank God I got the refills before this happened. Anyway, tons more
Going to file with the Board, BBB ETC .

name: Mandy Jones
text: I had surgery here and I didn't receive but a low dose of pain meds while in tears begging to go home talking to my nurse singing my papers she was like wow no wonder your hurting so bad she did read my chart what if she had given me the wrong medication also I was paying what I could every month but they turned in over to a collection agency so now it goes on my credit the are just money hungry and dont care about you they also let homeless people and drugged up people set in the ER waiting room they beg for money and try to steal your stuff if you go here good luck.

name: daphne richardson
text: I recently visited Dr. Williams (OBGYN), she was very informative and attentive but her nurse was very rude.

name: Brenden Perry
text: SWC and the doctors/nurses there have always been so  helpful and have always been there to assist with every medical need! I would recommend SWC to anyone that needs specialized care!

name: Lanard Crawford
text: Dr.C.Harris and his nurse especially Paula C are the worst people I have ever met all they want to do is keep on using your insurance he kept on telling me different stuff of wrong with me he must need to go back to medical school cuz he is doing in my opinion the worst doctor I have ever came in contact with and his staff are so rude and the doctor office is so nasty my opinion don't waste your time everytime I call I never got a return phone call he don't have time for his patients please don't waste your time going there

name: Grey Peterson

name: Caitlin Leonard
text:
This is my second time at Dr. Willis' office and it will definitely be my last. The first  time I went to her office  I didn't have any problems besides having to call to get my results and the office not answering their phones. This year her office emailed me about making my yearly appointment which I did. I called the office and was sent to voicemail which they ask you to leave information. After three days of not getting a response I called the office and the receptionist was nice and scheduled me for the only available appointment until August. The next day I received a call from another receptionist responding to my voicemail that I sent earlier that week..... The day of the appointment I called Dr. Willis office EIGHT times trying to get someone to help me locate the office (I hadn't been there in two years because of school). After the first three calls not being answered (15 minutes late to the appointment at this point) I was transferred to the emergency line (was on hold for 5 mins). Without even asking my needs I was transferred to another hotline which transferred me to another hotline that transferred me back to the original person I was trying to speak with! After being on hold multiple times for almost 15 minutes I hung up, called back and the exact same thing happened again. After 30 minutes of trying to find the office I finally was able to talk to someone and ended up canceling the appointment.

This was the most frustrating and difficult doctor's experience I've ever had. I do no recommend!

I would not trade her for anything in the world and I would recommend that if you want a  professional, spiritual and genuine person seek her services. When God made her, he broke the mold...she is one of a kind. We love  you Dr. Willis.

name: Moore and Young Legal Solutions
text:
I have been seeing Dr. Willis for the past six years. She has been a wonderful doctor over the years and her staff is equally as amazing.

In June 2015 I suffered a serious complication while pregnant, and my child had to be delivered seven weeks before her due date. Because of Dr. Willis's extensive knowledge, she was able to stabilize my vitals to allow additional time for my child's lungs to develop more. It was then I knew for sure that I would be a patient as long as I live in the Birmingham area.

Another thing I love about her is that she honest; even when I don't want to hear the truth. Lol! But she will lays everything out and answers all questions; thus giving you the ability to make an informed decision regarding your healthcare.

name: Jasmine Nolen
text: One of the worst doctors I've ever had in my life. She literally never answers the phone.

name: Paige Collins
text: I have seen Dr. Dozier about 6 times since early 2019. His nurse, Lauren has taken over 7 days to return my phone calls. She never returned my last one regarding a lab bill that she told me would be over $200 less than what it was. I pay out of pocket and require pricing up front so that I can prepare financially for procedures. I ask the front desk, the nurse and the Dr. what the cost out of pocket for my procedure is going to be. After my procedure I pay in full before I leave. But it NEVER fails.... a few days go by and I receive a bill for hundreds of dollars I wasn't prepared for. I pay these expenses by using pay my provider on the care credit website and 3 weeks later I get another bill with end of month type charges on it. I then have to call and tell them all my payment information and confirmation number etc. All while receiving attitude. I've dealt with the bs long enough. I will not be returning for follow up care.

resp.text: Hi Ms. Collins, please call our office and ask for our administrator. We would love the opportunity to discuss your experience with you. Women's Healthcare strives to provide the best level of service in the Wiregrass.

name: Taisheria Bradham
text:
I’m 23 weeks pregnant with my second child. My first child was delivered early via c section because of preeclampsia. My doctor with my first pregnancy retired so I decided to try women’s healthcare. I originally was seeing one doctor who told me my baby had a 50% chance of having spinia bifida or some other defect I was also mailed the wrong lab results. Not only that she called and corrected herself and said she was looking at someone else’s results and my baby was fine. I switched over to another doctor at women’s healthcare and today I was made to feel super uncomfortable. They sat outside the room and questioned my motherhood and why I came in/ called so much with blood pressure concerns. I also was told to get undressed because I explained I was having pressure but upon hearing someone say I don’t want to go In there I put my clothes back on a refused. I’ve been having pressure and light bleeding since Sunday and it’s sad I don’t feel comfortable enough to call my doctor or see my doctor. I really hope people learn to show compassion because there is already so many mean people in the world. You never know how much acts of kindness can go a long way especially for someone like me who just buried a relative this past Friday. I will
Continue to put my faith in god and hope for the best during this pregnancy.

name: Crystle Williams
text: Everyone at the center is very nice and helpful. I've never had to wait for more than 5 minutes before being called back and Dr. Dozier is amazing. His bedside manner and tendency to talk about normal things during the exam  makes one comfortable despite the general awkwardness of the procedure.

resp.text: Thank you for the great review Crystle! Dr. Dozier is a great doctor and we are so glad to have him as part of our team.

name: R Golden
text: Had my yearly mammogram which is paid for by my insurance company. Because they had someone out-of-network read the results I now owe money. They said I needed to dispute it with my insurance company and my insurance company said they've paid their share and that Women's Healthcare is at fault. So, I will now have to pay the money owed and I WILL NEVER USE THEM AGAIN! It's pretty bad when you charge your patient for your mistake! I would give them no stars if I could!

name: Audra Weaver
text: The doctors are mindful and caring, but the staff are rude and argumentative, not friendly, and slow. Wait time is always a minimum of 2 hours, even when you're the only person in the lobby. The staff also do not read notes left in accounts and do not always schedule (or somehow/mysteriously delete) every appointment/test you are explicity told by your doctor to have done.

Thank you, Women's Healthcare of Dothan staff and website / software architects.

name: Arial Roberts
text: DO NOT GO TO WOMENS HEALTHCARE OF DOTHAN. I have never been to a more unprofessional establishment such as womens healthcare of dothan. NO ONE EVER answers the phone. Everytime i recieved a call back it always is 2 minutes before they close so i cant call back. 2nd I was lied to and told my insurance would cover the visit and it did not.

name: S M
text:
Women's Healthcare of Dothan was highly recommended by a friend as the best OBGYN practice in town.o
Upon exiting the elevators, you'll be at the front desk area. There are 3 waiting rooms each almost completely out of sight of the reception desk area.
I arrived with my older children for my appt to take a pregnancy test. I had been informed over the phone that this was required before I could make my first prenatal appt. I hadn't experienced this with my previous pregnancies but everywhere is different.
The reason I was given for this requirement as a lot of women in the past have either lied about/ misread at-home pregnancy test results.
I arrived before my scheduled appt time, checked in, paid the $11 fee to take required lab test, informed that the practice was completely paperless so I wouldn't be given a checkout slip, asked to come back to the reception area to check out, and told to wait in waiting room 3 until the lab called me to take the pregnancy test.
I was seated in the waiting room 10 minutes before my appt time. I had one of the first lab appt times available so there were only a couple people in the waiting room. The waiting room is almost directly across to the open ares of the lab. The lab had several nurses/techs waiting around for more patients to arrive. I noticed that everyone who had arrived after me were being called immediately back to the lab. I waited 35 minutes after my scheduled appt time before I went to the front desk to figure out what was happening. When I asked one of the front desk if it was normal for new patients to wait this long just to take a pregnancy test. She was surprised and said the lab must have forgotten I was there. She called back to the lab and told me to go back to the waiting room. I could hear the lab nurse/tech say "Oh, oops. Yeah, we'll get her in."
I waited another 10 minutes before I was called to back. The nurse/tech asked how my day was going. I told her I was a bit frustrated with waiting so long. She told me that it wasn't the lab's fault as the front desk didn't actually check me in for my appt. The lab had no idea I was even waiting. She said it was also really my fault for not trying to figure out the problem sooner. After using the cup I had been handed, I returned to the lab area to find the nurse/tech. I waited in the lab area for 5 minutes before she returned. 60 mins after my appt time, I was informed that I was pregnant and the at-home test was correct. Everywhere is different and the practice had never seen me before so I kind of understand(given their past history) that I had to prove to them I wasn't lying. She wrote on a piece of paper my last cycle date and calculated due date. She told me to give the test results aka the paper she had just written on to the front desk to check out. So clearly, they aren't completely paperless. When I asked her where the test results actually were on this piece of paper she was confused and said "that the actual lab results didn't matter as I would be using their prenatal care anyway."
I went to the reception area to check out  and asked if I could get a copy of the paper aka the "test results" for myself. I was informed that would be against Federal Law for them to give me any of my test results. Then was told I would need to pay them upfront over double the amount of money I had been told over the phone. When I explained what I had been told by their insurance lady, I was told I was wrong. I asked them to call her which they did after complaining. Long story short, I had the correct info.
When I told them I would be going to another doctor practice. They were confused why I didn't want to continue to use them. They called records so I could get a copy of my test results. I was then informed I couldn't get a copy until it was put in the computer system and signed a general released(I did) and there wasn't a timeframe when they would mail me a copy.
This practice was the most unprofessional, rude, disorganized, misinformed practice I have ever gone too. Never again.

name: J G
text: Love Dr Johnston, Mullins and Dozier

resp.text: Thank you Jane! We love having you as a patient!

name: alyssa hunt
text: Just wanted to express how much I love this office, more specifically Dr. McIntosh!!! He has been the BEST OB I could’ve possibly gotten for my first pregnancy and has been the reason my experience has been the way it has and why I absolutely love the days I get to come here. He has a genuine, loving, caring attitude towards his patients that I have never felt like he has steered away from my entire pregnancy. I have some issues with anxiety and it has ran into my pregnancy (of course) but he has reassured me every time and is always thorough. I have my baby girl on the 16th and I cannot wait for him to be the one to bring her into this world!! I 100000x would recommend this place and Dr. McIntosh to anyone and everyone needing to find the perfect gynecologist!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words!  We're so happy to hear you've had such a positive experience with Dr. McIntosh and our office.  Please let us know if you need anything in the future and best wishes on your delivery!

name: Erika
text: When I moved here from Florida in Oct 2018 I took time to search for a Doctor that was very reputable because my Doctor back home was wonderful! I came across Dr. Conrad and all the great reviews so made an appointment to be established. He had a good bedside manner and listen to all my concerns. I knew eventually I was going to need a hysterectomy and read that he was one of the best. March 2021 I went to see him and discuss surgery. We both agreed it was time. My hysterectomy was April 13th and procedure went well. Post op I kept having cramps and very uncomfortable sitting up straight, was told at 4 week checkup that it would take time. 9 weeks post still had problems so made an appointment. I was told it was NOT normal and they did an ultrasound to make sure I had not developed cysts on my ovaries (that was all that I kept). No cysts but the vaginal ultrasound was painful and I've had plenty in my life to know they don't hurt, just uncomfortable. Dr. Conrad then expressed concern about the pain during the ultrasound and recommended I get some lab work and a CT scan. July 6th I go to hospital and get the scan with IV contrast. I get a call a few days later from a nurse saying that my tests were normal. When I proceed to ask medical questions I'm asked if I had a followup appointment scheduled. Of course not, I was told to get these tests done then we would go from there. She then tells me she can get me scheduled to followup and ask questions.. yeah so I have to pay more money! I've already spent several thousands last few months. I can understand a nurse calling you about normal bloodwork but this is we ALSO a CT scan. When I messaged on patient portal and asked for Dr. Conrad to call me and if this cramping was just something that may eventually go away with time.. the same nurse responded that I could give it 2 to 4 more weeks and if still having problems to call them. Ridiculous! I thought highly of Dr. Conrad until now. Even a followup call would have been nice. I guess I'll be on another search for a new Doctor.

name: Arielle Robinson
text: We just moved to Huntsville and found out we were pregnant November of 2020. I’m so glad I found Dr. Beauchamp she is absolutely wonderful. If you are looking for a wonderful obgyn look no further, she is very patient, kind and understanding. I never once felt rushed or felt like just a number, she was very down to earth and it was a pleasure seeing her and her team at our visits. Thank you so much for everything Dr. Beauchamp and team! You guys are incredible.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! We're so excited to hear about your experience with Dr. Beauchamp... We're very fortunate to have her! Please let us know if you ever need anything at all in the future!

name: Kristy Hudson
text: There are not enough words to properly recommend Dr. McIntosh and his entire staff. In 2019, I swapped doctors mid pregnancy with my first child due to issues with my previous Ob (whom I had seen for 10+ years). Although nervous and skeptical, I embraced the change and was completely blown away. Before meeting Dr. McIntosh his entire staff was SUPER kind, helpful, patient, and understanding. I met with Dr. McIntosh and felt at ease immediately. Dr. McIntosh is the reason why my daughter and I survived an emergency delivery due to a rare medical condition. I’ve continued seeing Dr. McIntosh postpartum and for annuals. I’ve never met a doctor with such an amazing bed side manner. He’s caring and compassionate when it comes to his patients. He’s answered thousands of my questions and I’ve never once felt judged or rushed. If you are in need of a doctor or interested in swapping, I HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend Dr. McIntosh & his entire staff.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! We're glad to hear that you have had such positive experiences with our office! Please let us know if you ever need anything else!

name: Angel Sanders
text: I moved from another state and needed to get into an OB for a yearly pap but also needed to talk to someone about my previous miscarriages and also finding out about some family members being diagnosed with endometriosis. I was nervous about finding a new doctor. I did a lot of research and found this office. I didn’t have a preference on doctor bc they all seemed to have great reviews so I called and made an appointment and said to schedule me with the first one who had an appointment available that fit my schedule. I went in with dr McIntosh and he was absolutely amazing. Just in my first visit he is already making effort to find answers for why I’ve had so many miscarriages. He immediately scheduled bloodwork and an ultrasound and has a plan set and said he wants to find me answers. He’s already done so much more than my previous dr and I’ve only seen him one. But just a heads up, there’s a lady in the front office that was RUDE to me about my insurance. Like I’ve never been treated so bad. It gave me a bad taste and bad first impression but once I talked to McIntosh it made me feel so much better. But she was definitely uncalled for. But I would recommended dr McIntosh in a heartbeat. It feels so good to finally have someone who cares and wants to help.

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to leave us a review!  We're so glad to hear you've had such a positive experience.  Please let us know if you need anything in the future.

name: Erin Dwyer
text: I absolutely love Dr. McIntosh! I've seen him for a year now and he oversaw my third pregnancy, delivered my daughter and now I see him for my postpartum and annual wellness appointments. He's very mellow, super friendly, gives great recommendations and always makes me feel extremely comfortable - even more than some female providers I've seen in the past. I have recommended him to several people and will most definitely continue to see him going forward. My husband and I were so thrilled with our delivery experience with him! Cannot recommend him enough, he's fantastic :)

resp.text: Thanks so much for your kind words!  We're so glad to hear about your experience with Dr. McIntosh...We certainly feel fortunate to have him as a part of our practice!  Please let us know if you ever need anything at all from our practice!

name: L H
text: I was very impressed with Dr. McIntosh. He listened, he did not rush me, he asked me preventative care questions. I am new to this practice and it is night and day between this and my old huge practice in town. It was easy to get an appointment at this practice (2 weeks from calling) and I only waited 5 minutes in the lobby. Big thumbs up and already recommended this doctor to two other women.

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to share about your experience! Thanks also for sharing about our practice with others! Please let us know if you ever need anything from us at all! Thanks again!

Not only was Dr. McIntosh great, his staff was amazing as well! Front desk ladies were polite and his nurse was very kind and a good ice breaker. I cannot say it enough, WONDERFUL experience.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! We're so glad to hear you had such a great experience! Please let us know if you need anything else in the future!

text: I absolutely love Dr Conrad.  He is one of the best doctors that I have ever seen. He takes time to explain what's going on and works with you on treatment with one of the best bedside manners I've ever come across.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words!  Thanks for entrusting us to take care of your healthcare needs and please don't hesitate to let us know if we can help you in the future!

name: L Raymond
text: Dr. McIntosh delivered my mono-di twins via C-section in October, he has been my obgyn doctor since the beginning of my pregnancy. I was nervous and worried due to the type of twin pregnancy I had. Dr. McIntosh helped keep a close monitoring of the babies along the way. He is very patient, gentle, and understanding. The wait time in the lobby can be lengthy sometimes over 30 minutes, but this doesn't happen all the time. When I went to the hospital due to signs of preterm labor, I was glad that Dr. McIntosh was there, he was very calm and answered all my questions because I was so nervous about delivering early, the C-section surgery went well and my scar healed great after the surgery. My overall experience at Advanced ObGyn was great, I would recommend it to anyone looking for new obgyn.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! We're so glad to hear everything went well with your delivery and throughout your pregnancy! Please let us know if you need anything from us in the future!

name: Evan Shelton
text: I have accompanied my wife to Advanced OBGYN for 2/2 visits during her first trimester. Although we always arrive 15 minutes early we always wait over an hour past our appointment time to be seen. The doctor usually makes his appearance 1.5 hours into the appointment time (e.g., appointment is at 9:00am; the md appears at 10:30am). It is wonderful for a husband to be able to be there for his wife through this process, but Advanced OBGYN requires almost an entire day of PTO (with the drive, the wait, then the appointment).

resp.text: Evan, we're very sorry about your experience.  We pride ourselves on offering the very best care possible to each of our patients.  There are a number of things which can cause delays like what you've experienced.  First of all, our doctors really make every effort to be there to deliver their patient's babies and babies obviously don't always schedule what time they arrive.  Many practices will leave deliveries to an on-call physician, but we have found that most patients want "their doctor" to be there for the delivery since they've been seeing the physician for 9 months.  Our doctors do everything they can to be with the patient all the way through delivery which is not typical for many practices.  As a result of offering this level of care, there may be times when wait times are a little longer, but rest assured, our doctors will make every effort to be there for your wife when she delivers.  They do everything they can to make sure it's a familiar face in the delivery room when it's that time.  Additionally, our schedule has been additionally challenging because of the constant changes in elective surgery practices our physicians have had to adjust to (due to COVID-19).  Normally, each of our physicians have a set day that they do surgeries, but both of the hospitals have had various different policies on surgeries lately and it's caused our physicians to sometimes have to do surgeries before they start seeing patients and many times these surgeries are scheduled last minute due to the constantly changing policies of the hospitals.  While this is not ideal, we don't have much control of this and are having to do surgeries when we can right now.  This, unfortunately, has caused several delays as well! If you're ever at our practice and your wait time is unacceptable, please know that our nurse practitioner or another one of our physicians will be more than happy to see you.  We try to mention that availability to our patients, but feel free to ask one of the receptionists or nurses if your are interested in this option.  Also, in the last month or so, we've had a number of staff shortages that we've had to work through.  While this is not an excuse, it's just something we've been trying our hardest to work through.  We're excited that help is on the way though, because we're hiring 5 new employees that will start on January 4th.  All 5 of these new employees have between 10 and 25+ years of ObGyn experience and should help our office move much more smoothly!  Finally, some of our physicians are busier than others since some of them have been practicing in the area for a longer period of time.  If your wife is interested in seeing another one of our physicians that is newer to the area and not as busy, please let a staff member know and we'll do our best to accommodate you request.  Again, we sincerely apologize about your experience so far and please feel free to reach out to us directly if we can be of any assistance to you or your wife.

name: Kari Kasumi
text: I love Advanced OBGYN. It's so easy to be a patient here. My CRNP Elizabeth Fondren is a dream and is always so sweet and effective. She makes me feel at ease and answers all of my questions thoroughly. I don't plan on having a baby but if I did I know that I would feel at ease knowing Elizabeth and the team at Advanced OBGYN were taking care of me and my little baby. You can't go wrong and won't be disappointed here. 🖤

resp.text: Thank you so much!  We're thankful to have Elizabeth as a part of our team and are thrilled to hear you've had such a great experience with her!

name: Alison Cornelius
text: Dr.McIntosh has been nothing but the best! He has been patient with all of my questions and concerns after surgery.  He takes time to help make you feel at ease about everything.   I drive almost an hour and half to see him and so thankful I found him! Everyone in the office is so nice and helpful.  I highly recommend this place!

resp.text: Thanks so much for your kind words! We're honored that you come from so far to see us! Please let us know if we can be of any help in the future!

Trust me, choosing him will be the best choice you ever made and you will feel safe and remain healthy. Thanks Dr McIntosh from the Jones family!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! We're very thankful to have Dr. McIntosh as a part of our practice! Please let us know if you need anything else from us in the future!

name: Meleighsa McLaughlin
text: When my previous doctor retired, he referred me to Dr. Conrad. He’s smart and candid and he has a sweet and professional staff. He loves some football, so don’t let your sister start that conversation if she comes with you and you actually want to get out of the office! They get busy sometimes and that causes a longer wait. So while he’s worth it, try not to schedule anything else after your appointment.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words! Please let us know if you need anything in the future and we are thankful for the opportunity to serve you!

name: Olivia Guerra
text: I have been going to Advanced OBGYN for about 10 years now. Dr. Conrad has always been phenomenal. He is so caring, gentle, and knowledgeable. You can tell he really takes his job seriously and is passionate about it. Unfortunately, he’s gotten so busy over the past few years that he had to bring other doctors on. I have been seeing Elizabeth for about a year now. She is just as amazing as Dr. Conrad. She is easy to talk to, understanding, knowledgeable, and caring. I feel 100% taken care of with her. I highly, highly recommend Advanced OBGYN. The whole staff is professional, friendly, and supportive. You may have to wait longer than expected sometimes at your appointment, but they do their best to accommodate.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! We're grateful for the opportunity to serve you! Please let us know if you ever need anything from us!

name: Kendra Velasco
text: I had Dr. McIntosh through my first pregnancy (twins) and he was great. I healed great from my C Section, very small scar which was a bog deal to me. 💁 I recommend Advanced ObGyn to anyone
