name: Abby Pepper Abernathy
text: Dr. Mcintosh is amazing! He was so kind, knowledgeable and professional. The entire staff was amazing! I 100% recommend this office!

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing! We're thankful for the opportunity to serve you! Please let us know if you need anything from us in the future!

name: Irasema Swope
text: After moving from out of state and having an initial OBGYN that I was not satisfied with I switched over to Dr. McIntosh and it was the best decision I have made. I didn't think I would ever be as comfortable as I was with my old OBGYN from before we moved but I am! He is kind, caring, knowledgeable, and listens to all and every concern. With having contractions early and having to constantly go to L&D he has made sure that everything is always okay and making sure things are not worsening. His nurse is also amazing and always kind. Nothing but positive things to say about them!

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to share those kind words! We're thankful for the opportunity to help serve you! Please let us know if you need anything in the future!

name: Megan Carter
text: Received less than stellar service and dealt with people at the front desk that didn’t seem to know the answers to many things. Transferred to a different doctor 3 months into my pregnancy and tried for the next 3 1/2 months to get my records sent to my new doctor. My new doctor tried, too. If you call after hours you can’t just leave a message and the answering service was rude and no help. And speaking of office hours they were also terrible. I feel like anytime I tried to call they were closed. Every appointment I had to wait 30-45 min or more past my appointment time and the last appointment I waited over an hour in the lobby. After seeing the nurse I waited for the doctor (who I had never met at this point). After waiting 15 minutes I heard him talking outside my door telling a nurse he had to leave. I then waited another 15 minutes and still nobody came to tell me he had left and I could go. We finally just walked out. The ultra sound techs I saw were very sweet, though. They were about the only highlight there.

resp.text: We apologise that you were not satisfied with the service that you received at our office. Over the last few months we've unfortunately had some turnover with our front office.  We've made changes to our staff that we hope will resolve this issue.  We pride ourselves in offering the best possible service and always strive to exceed our patients expectations.  As far as our call service is concerned... That is a totally separate company that we have no control of. Unfortunately, in Huntsville there are very few options for call services and we are currently exploring other options since we have had several issues with our current call service. Finally, we apologize about links he waits that you may have had... Unfortunately, in the field of ob-gyns delays are common as we never know when babies are on their way. We do our best to keep patients informed of delays.  Again, we apologize about your negative experience and please feel free to call her office and ask for management if we can help you in any way. We want to make things right!

name: Annette Perez
text: I have Dr.Mcintosh and he is absolutely the best. I have come in even on emergency visits and he always is concerned, understanding and takes care the best way possible. He make me comfortable. The nurses are all amazing they are sweet and very interested in how you are Everytime. The front office staff is awesome as well. I would recommend them a thousand times. And I haven't even given birth yet. This is my first pregnancy and they have helped to make this experience the best so far. Thank you all!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much!  We're fortunate to have Dr. McIntosh as part of our practice!  Thanks for allowing us the opportunity to serve you!

name: Allyson Batte
text:
First of all, I hope this comes off coherently because I am livid at the moment with this practice.
Secondly, since they are closed, I cannot even leave a voicemail. Which seems absolutely ridiculous. Are we still in 2019?
I had my first appointment with this practice when I was 10.5 weeks pregnant. Doctor asked if I wanted to do the genetic screen blood test. Said specifically we would find out risk levels AND the gender of the baby. Said normal wait time was 5 to 7 day. I said yes, so he takes me to their lab area to get my blood drawn. During this same appointment he said I had a cyst that I should get scanned again in two weeks. When we hit the 11 day mark of not hearing about the blood results, we called to find out why. After a day of back and forth we hear back they never took the correct blood. They only took the blood for the normal blood work, not the genetic screening. Strike one.
They apologize and say that they will get me in right away to get it taken. Since I had an appointment in 4 days (to check on the cyst) I said I would just wait until then to get the blood drawn.
I go in for my appointment that was supposed to scan for the cyst. Literally no mention what so ever about cyst. They only take my blood for the genetic screening. Strike two. Again, talk to the doctor and he says again, he should have the results back in 5 to 7 days.
14 days after the blood draw we call because we still have not heard anything. They call back saying that I am low risk, which is good, but they did not have the gender results. When we asked why, we were told that they did not request them. What. The. Hell. Also, if they had the results, why did they not call us????? Why did we have to call them to find out? Strike three!
The doctor specifically told us on both occasions that we would be able to find out the gender of our baby.
And now, because it is after hours, I can't even leave a voicemail! Their voicemail system sucks during business hours to begin with.
I have zero understanding how this practice is so well rated. The doctor is okay, but the front staff and nursing staff are unorganized.
My cyst is left unchecked and I am still waiting for results that I should have had over 3 weeks ago.
Terrible service. I am pulling my records and going elsewhere.

resp.text: Ms. Parker, We're so sorry that you didn't have a positive experience at our office.  I think you've had the opportunity to speak with our office manager by now and we hope that the resolutions we've made available to you have helped.  We really try to give every patient the very best treatment and care and we apologize that you didn't receive that.  While it's certainly no excuse, we've had multiple staff out all at once all on maternity or medical leave and as a result, we've probably dropped the ball some.  However, plain and simple, we dropped the ball in several areas in several areas of your care and have tried to make sure something like that never happens again.  As far as the voicemail situation is concerned, we are required to forward our phone calls to a 3rd party answering service when we're not open.  This is because we are required to have 24/7 phone coverage in the event of a medical emergency that would require one of our physicians to immediately respond.  As a result, when we receive calls after hours, they are routed to this answering service instead of our office which would allow the ability to leave a message.  Our normal phone system does allow you to leave messages, but when we're not here, that is not an option and we are required to forward to an outside call service.  Should you choose to give us another chance and we are able to offer you the exceptional service you deserve, we'd like to ask you to consider updating your rating of our practice.  Again, we apologize and hope to have the opportunity to prove ourselves to you in the future.

name: agnes snodgrass
text: Dr. Conrad delivered both of my children. When he is in the room you have his undivided attention. He always answered any questions  I had with open and honest explanations. Even if it was to debunk some nonsense i read online. I saw Elizabeth for several of my per-natal visits she was equally knowledgeable and attentive. The office keeps up to date on the latest research. so i am confident that i am getting the care that is backed by the latest medical research. the office staff and nurses are always very helpful and understanding. Even if they are running behind (something that is unavoidable for an OB) I don't mind because I'm confident that I'm receiving the best possible care from people who truly care about their patients.

resp.text: Thanks for sharing your experience!  Dr. Conrad, Dr. McIntosh, and Elizabeth all constantly study to stay up-to-date!  They always want to provide our patients with the best possible information and help them make informed decisions on their healthcare.  Thanks for entrusting us to provide you with care!

name: Alyssa Knight
text:
Dr. Conrad is kind and knowledgeable. He has delivered two children, and my experiences were excellent both times. He is thorough in explanations of any concerns and takes the time to be with his patients. Only downside is you sometimes have to wait for him. He is well worth the wait!

I have also seen Elizabeth. Seeing Elizabeth had little wait time (because she not delivering babies). She had a great confidence about her, and I have had a positive experience everytime I have seen her.

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to leave us a review! We're glad to hear that you've had such positive experiences with Dr Conrad and Elizabeth! Please let us know if you ever need anything from us in the future.

I ran into someone today and she recognized me and asked that I be sure to pass along that she had an AMAZING delivery with him. She said he really took the time to make her feel unrushed during delivery. Her family recognized his patience with the birth experience as well. Kudos to you Dr. McIntosh!

resp.text: Thanks so much for taking the time to share! We're really glad to have him working in our office! We hope you are doing well! Thanks again for sharing!

name: Beth Rogers
text: I love Dr. Conrad and all of the nurses, doctors, and staff! I never feel like he is rushing to get me out of the office. He always makes sure he has answered every question before I leave.  I am so thankful he delivered my first baby. He did a fantastic job! He even helped the nurses clean up after the delivery. I can't say enough good things about this place! I highly recommend this practice!

resp.text: Thanks for your review!  We are so glad to hear that you've had positive experiences in our office.  If we can ever be of assistance to you, please let us know!

name: Kristin Posey

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words!  We're glad to hear that you've had such a great experience!  We're thankful to have Dr. McIntosh & Elizabeth as a part of our practice!  Please let us know if you ever need anything in the future!

name: Gregory Palermo
text: While at first we had issues with the off-duty weekend support, our concern was addressed once we were able to get management involved. As per your response below I had called on 22 Sep 2018 around 1030 AM. The nurse who answered was particularly nasty. That is why I had originally left my negative comment. I greatly appreciate you taking the time to contact us and address our concern. Thank you for your help in resolving our issue.

resp.text: First off, we sincerely apologize for your experience. On occasion, we send prescriptions to the pharmacies and for whatever reason, they don't receive them on their end. It is rare, but it does happen. We have also found that certain pharmacies are worse than others. We apologize that it didn't make it to the pharmacy, but once we send it, there's no way for us to verify whether the pharmacy successfully receives it or not. We also apologize that you weren't able to reach out office, but please note that our office is always closed on Fridays at noon. To see our full hours, please visit our website. Unfortunately, we have absolutely no control over the call service personnel that takes our calls outside of business hours.  They are an outside company that handles calls for many different offices in our area. If you happened to get a name or can tell us approximately when you called, please let us know so that we can notify the call service. Also, after noon on Fridays through Monday morning, different doctors rotate taking calls and our doctors were not the ones on call this weekend. We are sincerely sorry that you've had this experience and will do everything we can to make it right! Please understand that it sounds like a lot of the negative experience you may have had on the phone was not with anyone in our office. Having said that, it is also not acceptable and we will do what we can to make sure it never happens again. Please call our office on Monday morning and ask for our office manager and we will make sure you are taken care of. We will also notify the call service about this incident. Finally, thank you for your service.

name: Amanda Pettus
text:
I love Dr. Conrad! He's never been anything except patient, kind, compassionate, and helpful. He's there to talk with you over your health, and he's not in a hurry. He's taken a personal interest in my health as I believe he does with all his patients.

I chose him as my OB for my two pregnancies because I had heard he was supportive of natural, drug-free births, and I'm so glad I did. He was completely supportive (and understanding) of my wishes, and I had full confidence that he wouldn't try to "pull a fast one" on me during labor. He was encouraging, patient, and lavished praise on me (just what a mother who has given birth needs to hear!). I recommend him to everyone I know. He has delivered babies for both my sisters and a dozen of my friends, and we ALL love him!

I met with the nurse practitioner, Ms. Fondren, for my yearly screening, and she was so helpful in listening to some of my concerns and discussing options with me. I don't know Dr. McIntosh, but the few times I've encountered him in the hall, he was friendly. The ultrasound tech and nurses have also been very kind and helpful.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing those kind words! We feel like all of our providers are great and are glad to hear of your positive experiences! Please let us know if you have any questions or need anything in the future!

name: Kaitlin Werth
text: We love Dr. Conrad! You may have a longer wait time in the waiting room, but it's because he will stay with you as long as you need to have your questions answered without feeling rushed. He is thorough and well-informed, as well as personable. His staff is also amazing, and many remembered my name throughout my pregnancy. Thankful for this office!

resp.text: Thanks for sharing!  Dr. Conrad belives very strongly in making sure that all of his patients' questions are answered.  We are also glad to hear about your experience with our staff!  We are fortunate to have professional, hard-working employees!

text: I am so pleased I found this practice.  Dr. Conrad came in and had conversation with me -- before I had to undress.  How refreshing! The wait time once you get back to a room can be long, but only because they ensure *everyone* gets the same personal, in-depth care.  I highly recommend this practice.  :)

name: Hannah Pittman
text: Dr. McIntosh has exceeded my expectations! He is wonderful in his manner of treating, managing, and listening to patients. I am so thankful Dr. McIntosh was recommended to me!

resp.text: Thanks so much for taking the time to share! We're grateful for the opportunity to serve you and please let us know if we can help you in the future!

They were prompt in answering all of my questions, and addressing any issues I had during and after my pregnancy. I highly recommend Advanced OB/GYN.

name: Pat Sims
text: Having been a long time patient of Dr. Conrad's I cannot express how much I appreciate his office.  From the front desk to the nursing staff all the way to check out my experiences have always been professional and timely. Even though my family and I have moved to Shelby County, two hours away, I continue to use Dr. Conrad.  I would definitely,  and have recommended friends to him.

name: Danielle Collins
text: I can't express enough how much I love Dr. Conrad! I have had 2 surgeries by him and he has literally saved me!! My second surgery I had been having progressive pain for the past 2 years to the point I couldn't take it anymore. He found the issues, performed surgery, and after one week I was back to my old self and felt amazing!! Like everyone below said I had a bad experience with a previous Dr, someone recommended Dr Conrad and he found the issues and made sure I was comfortable with everything.  He does what's in the best interest of the patient and listens to what you have to say.  He will take his time during your appointment to make sure he has addressed any questions. That is so rare in a doctor now days.  I see people getting frustrated in the waiting room having to wait but what they don't understand is you have to wait anywhere you go but Dr. Conrad is totally worth it!! The time you are waiting, someone else does too when he is taking his time with you. I have seen Elizabeth once also and she was just as wonderful!!

name: Laurie McFalls
text: Dr. Conrad is amazing. He discovered health issues that no one else even tested for.  I left my previous OB after a very negative experience.  Dr. Conrad made me feel at ease right away.  He was compassionate and understanding.  He even called me after hours to go over my lab results with me.  I would absolutely recommend him to anyone.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your kind words!  It is a pleasure to have the opportunity to serve you!

name: Kristi Kingery
text: Wonderful, caring staff and doctors! I had a tiny meltdown during one visit and they were amazingly sweet and caring. I can't thank them enough for all the help and care that was given. I have recommended them to my daughter and that's about as good of a review as I can give.

resp.text: Thanks so much for taking the time to let us know how we're doing! We are very appreciative of your referrals! Please let us know if you have any questions or needs in the future.

name: Half Pint
text:
Dr. Conrad is the epitome of a great physician. Most doctors read your chart before they walk in for your appointment and forget about you as soon they leave the room. I've had only two appointments with Dr. Conrad and that was 4 months ago. He was attentive and had a genuine concern for my wellbeing.  He was thorough in running tests and lab work to try and find the cause of my symptoms.
Dr. Conrad called me personally to discuss the results of my lab work and gave his recommendations on how to handle it. The fact that he called me after my appointment blew me away, but I was shocked when he called me tonight and asked how I was doing 4 months later! The personal call and follow up was completely unexpected, but totally appreciated. I can finally stop the search for my OBGYN. Thanks Dr. Conrad!!

resp.text: Thanks for your kind words! Please let us know if we can help you in the future!

name: Kristen Ivey
text: I have been a patient of Dr. Conrad for the last 5 years and absolutely love his office! He has the BEST bedside manner and never makes you feel rushed to get out. He takes the time to answer all your questions and truely cares! He delivered my first son and has also done another surgery for me that went very smooth! I highly recommend his office!!!

resp.text: Thanks for sharing your experience.  We are always thankful to hear that our patients have recommended us to their friends and family.  Please let us know if you ever have any questions or anything that we can assist you with!

name: Christina Bouchard
text: Dr Conrad is knowledgeable, professional, and nice! He helped us make the decision the induce my daughter, saving her life, and released me from the hospital 11 hours after giving birth because she'd been transferred so I could see her, apologizing all the while that he hadn't got there sooner! His own children were born without intervention :) so he understands and is willing to let women have their babies naturally, but knows when it is right to intervene.

name: Devin Bray
text: I love Dr. Conrad he is a great doctor. What I don't love is the staff that runs the office. The older lady at the front desk is always rude. On top of that, I recently called asked the office to get some of my records from my surgery after calling the hospital and them telling me they don't have any. Get a call back from Advanced OBGYN saying they do not have them and that I will have to call the hospital and gave me a some numbers to call. I don't know of a doctors office that doesn't keep their patients records from surgery but maybe that's just them. But I called the hospital once again and same thing, they did not have anything. Called Advanced OBGYN back again and left a message for them to get back with me and to confirm with Conrad that he did indeed take pictures. The girl calls back and says she "thinks" its protocol to take images during a surgery. She then goes on to tell me that they can't call and get my records... They can't get records for THEIR patient from a surgery that THEIR doctor preformed? Any medical personal will tell that's a load of trash. When I said okay I guess i'll just have to cut my losses I was told to have a good day. I then decided that that was ridiculous and her lack of concern after being told another doctor I am seeing needs these to review, is pathetic. As medical professionals it should've been handled completely different. If a patient is having an issue obtaining their records that the office is claiming to have done,  why would they not call to help? Left a voicemail for the office manager days ago and she has yet to return my call. Thankfully the lady over medical records at Huntsville Hospital did returned my call and informed me that no images were ever taken. Would not recommend if you want things handled in a timely manner and or handled at all.

resp.text: First off, let us begin by apologizing for all that you've been through to get these records.  Certain records such as imaging are kept on the systems at the hospitals since we're in their facilities and using their equipment.  At the same time, we keep detailed records on all our patients as well in accordance with the laws and regulations.  Sometimes the hospital will have certain records related to surgeries or procedures that we don't have on our systems but can access.  About 2 months ago, Huntsville Hospital converted over to a totally new system and we don't have any access to it at all like we did with the old system.  As a result, while we used to be able to quickly access this type of information, their hospital system has had numerous issues with the new software that has created a nightmare for our practice, other practices, and patients going through their facilities.  Our office manager attempted to call you yesterday but wasn't able to reach you.  Please know that we have tried multiple times to call and get the records as well, but have thus far been unable to get what you're requesting either.  Again, we apologize that this wasn't explained and handled the way it probably should have been.  Please call our office and ask for our office manager so that we can have an opportunity to better explain and make things right!

name: Margaret Morris
text: Had a new patient appointment because I was pregnant and thought the positive reviews meant this place was going to be awesome. Appt was at 2:15. Showed up early to make sure paperwork was good to go. Waiting 45 mins to have a sweet nurse take my weight and bp. Waited another 20 mins for the ultrasound tech to come get me before I had to walk out. Will find care elsewhere. Seem too busy to handle their patients in a timely manner.

resp.text: We apologize for the experience that you had at our office today.  Unfortunately, we had multiple patients in labor all at once today (one of which was an urgent situation) and one of our doctors that would normally be able to handle those deliveries was out of town for a family function.  Our practice tries very hard to give every patient that comes in our doors the utmost in care and attention.  However, when the "stars all line up" in the wrong way and there are multiple patients in labor at the hospital, it unfortunately causes delays for our patients in the office, but this is typical for any ObGyn as babies don't make appointments for when they're going to make their appearance!  Again, we are sorry about your experience, but also hope you can recognize that in a field such as ObGyn, delays do indeed occur!  We wish you all the best and stand ready to assist you if you ever change your mind!

name: amy campbell
text: I became a patient of Dr. Conrad's when I first became pregnant in 2014. He was highly recommended by a close friend and I was not dissapointed. He has great bedside manner and is a very compassionate and caring person. Several months later I became pregnant again and due to past history had to be monitored closely early on. After finding out I would miscarry that pregnancy as well, they ran a few tests to figure out what the cause might be. We soon had answers and a treatment and I became pregnant again a few months later. He still kept a close eye on me and was always great to give me plenty of time to address any questions or concerns. I gave birth to a healty baby boy in April and I could not be more thankful for Dr. Conrad and the rest of the staff at Advanced Ob/gyn!

name: Heather Neese
text:
My experience was pretty good. The tablet at check in was easy, and staff was friendly. I'm giving a 2, because a week later I got a bill from pathgroup for almost $200. I'm 28 years old, a registered nurse, educated on how things work in healthcare, and I've never received a bill like that. I went in because I was having some pain and they did a swab for infection. I saw Dr. McIntosh and he is new,  so the only thing I can think is he ran some crazy test. The total was over $1000 at pathgroup. When I called the office to figure it out they told me I didn't owe them money, wouldn't explain what charges they sent to pathgroup were, and were so rude to me. I then called pathgroup like the office said to, and they were rude to be as well. They told me they don't choose the charges and to talk to the office. So it was a circle of no answers with rude employees. Needless to say I won't be back.
To add I always pay my bills, I would like to know what I'm paying for though. Especially since my insurance hasn't changed in years, it's good coverage, and I've came in for the same things in the past and never ever been charged that. Kinda strange it would just start now.

resp.text: We apologize that this happened. If it was from PathGroup, there is little we can do because we don't have any access to their system. We are sorry that the information you requested wasn't given to you (we can tell you what codes are sent) and certainly apologize if you felt that you were not treated well. If you have specific questions about billing, please always request the insurance department and they should be able to assist you. Also  if you still feel things are not right, you can always ask for management and we will make sure this doesn't happen and that any questions are answered. Again, we apologize and hope you will give us a chance to make things right!

name: Lauren Martin
text: Hands down best obgyn office!! Can't say enough positive things about Dr. Conrad and his whole staff.

resp.text: Thanks a lot for sharing you experience.  We're thankful for all of our patients and do our very best to provide you with worldclass healthcare.

name: Whitney Grimes
text: I love Dr. Conrad, his associates, and his office staff! I also coordinate cases with them and they are just a pleasure to work with!!

resp.text: Thanks so much for sharing that with us!  We feel very lucky to have a great staff and providers that really want the best for their patients!

name: Tanya Stumpe
text: Dr. Conrad is awesome and his staff is helpful to. I would not go anywhere else.

resp.text: Thanks for sharing that with us!  We're so happy to hear that you've had positive experiences with us.  Please let us know if we can help you in the future!

name: Tanja Mitchell
text: Dr. Conrad takes his time with all of his patients. He listens and is very respectful.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words! We always try to make our patients the center of our attention. Thanks again and let us know if you ever need anything from us!

name: Hayles H
text: Dr McIntosh and his staff are great! They are very professional and friendly!

resp.text: Thanks for sharing!  We have been so excited to have Dr. McIntosh as a part of our practice.  He really enjoys the opportunities to be there for his patients!  Thanks again for sharing with us!

name: Debby Jennings
text: Love Dr. Conrad. Great office staff.

resp.text: Thanks so much!  We are blessed to have a wonderful staff and doctors that really care about their patients!  Please let us know if we can ever help you in the future!

name: Cristy Pilgrim
text: Dr Conrad is an excellent physician that takes the time to really listen.

resp.text: Thanks so much!  Dr. Conrad strongly believes in listening to everything his patients have to say because it allows him to provide the care that his patients need and deserve!

name: Wanda Sanders
text: Nice Doctors and staff

resp.text: Thanks so much!! We're thankful for the opportunity to serve you!

name: no name
text: Most wonderful and caring doctors and staff ever!

resp.text: We appreciate you sharing that!  We think we have 3 great providers and a wonderful staff!  It's always nice to hear that from others though!  Please let us know if we can ever help you with anything in the future!

name: T Hall
text: Kind, caring, and professional.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words!  Please let us know if we can ever help you in the future!

name: Robert L. Slappey Jr.
text: outstanding service.

resp.text: Thanks for your review! We really try to offer outstanding service to all of our patients and are happy to hear about your experiences!

name: Heather Snider
text: Love Dr. Conrad and his staff!!!

resp.text: Thanks!  We are grateful to serve you and all our patients!

name: Jeanice Walters
text: Dr. Conrad is a WONDERFUL doctor!

resp.text: Thanks! We appreciate your time in letting us know how we're doing. Feel free to contact us if you have any questions or need anything else!

name: Brandy “BB” Whitten
text: Love Dr. Middleton and Dr. Phillips! Both have made me feel so at ease and comfortable.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Brandy!

name: Pene’Lopii&Mommy Blythers
text: Omg! The best place for any woman. It has a comfortable environment 💙. The nurses are wonderful& very respectful.Dr.Middleton is my obygn and he’s the best the moment I met him he was and is amazing!!! I recommend this place to any woman.

name: Kelley colarusso
text: I have been seeing Dr. Middleton for many years & he is a wonderful doctor.  Obogyn visits are always so awkward, but he has never made feel uncomfortable.  I'm going through some tough times right now dealing w/Endometriosis & he is not a doctor that will just brush me off.  He has & is trying everything possible to help me.  Need a great Obogyn, then go see Dr. Middleton!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, Kelley!

name: Just Me
text: All the staff has been quite friendly, but I've never waited less than an hour and half after my scheduled appointment just to be called back, and then at least another hour just be seen afterwards. Even for simple follows ups, where Dr. Voss is in the room for less than ten minutes. My first appointment there had me waiting for four hours to be called back. Clearly, too many people get scheduled at one time in place that may also need to make time for random emergencies.

name: G B
text: I've had nothing but great experiences with Dr.Voss as well as the entire staff. They are very thorough and patient with any of my questions or concerns. I'm ok with waiting at times because some situations need a little more attention. The longest I've waited has been an hour and that was because she was delivering a baby that day.  People will wait in a restaurant for hours to eat but gripe about the time it takes to take care of your health.  Great job to this staff dealing with today's society.

name: A01
text: DO NOT GO TO DR. VOSS. I moved to Dothan towards the middle of my pregnancy in 2018. I was initially seeing another doctor who I loved but Voss delivered my son. At my 6 week check up, I informed her that I have fibroids and wanted to be prescribed the same medication that I was on prior to pregnancy to decrease the pain from menstrual cycles. She flat out told me that SHE did not believe in pain reliever medication and would not prescribe it. She also stated that my birth control should “handle it” and walked out of the room without allowing me to respond. I never returned to that office. She is a horrible doctor! She showed me that day that her views were more important than my health and my pain. That’s more than unprofessional.

name: Tore Hudson
text: People are great. Wait times are ridiculous.

name: Jill Biggs
text: They are the Best .

name: Angelique B.
text: Dr. Voss is the worst. I have waited for over an hour after my schedules appointment for all my appointment. This appointment today I’m at 2 hours and still waiting. She’s so disconnected with her patients. She a promonda that knows if a patient is her we need help. But instead she makes you wait until she’s ready to see you. I will call my insurance and change her as my caregiver. The worst ever!!!

name: Ronniesha Oliver
text: Dr. Voss is great. It takes some time but she's very thorough with her patients and make sure all your needs and complaints are taken care of I couldn't ask for a better doctor.

name: ARLEA MCDANIEL
text: Dr. Torrance has been my gynecologist since I moved back to Alabama since 2016.  She did my hysterectomy and I must say she is one of the best doctors that I have had since moving back.  For me she is very comfortable to talk to and very thorough.  Now I can say a few times that I have been there I have had to wait at least 45 minutes for her or her assistants to come in the room and one time I thought that they forgot I was there.

name: Beth Holland
text: I've been a patient of Ladies First for 6 years. Dr. Voss spends time with me to answer any questions that I may have.  She is attentive and listen to my concerns. The nurses are quick to call back me back with any questions I may have. The staff is professional and knowledgeable, always accommodating!  I am especially fond of the Enterprise office, these ladies are true caretakers and love their jobs, it shows!  I've also used Sabrina Kelley for weight loss and got great results.  I recommend Ladies First of Dothan for any type of women's needs.

resp.text: What a marvelous comment. Thank you!

name: Wendy Golemon
text: My overall experience was great at. Ladies First. I was greeted when I walked in and made to feel like a friend not a patient. Angeline and Skyler at the front desk make you feel welcome and answer any questions you have. The nurses assistant Jamila was friendly and helped with my anxiety of being there. Then, I met Pam Jones the ARNP and she was wonderful at easing your mind and very knowledgeable. Dr.Voss also stopped in and introduced herself. She was really friendly and explained everything she was doing and answered all questions I had. I definitely will keep this provider! Great service!

name: Aubrey Miller
text: I want to start off by saying I was hesitant to come to this OBGYN office based on some other reviews. I noticed a pattern that a lot of reviewers complained of the wait time and I will say that I did have a couple appointments where I waited a little longer to be seen. It really wasn’t that long so it was barely worth mentioning but I figured I would since it seems to be an issue with other patients. But knowing what I know now I understand why. Dr. Voss is amazing. I came in for my pregnancy and ended up being high risk. She explained everything in great detail and what the plan would be for my pregnancy. She even addressed why there may be a longer wait time sometimes, which I didn’t even bring up, but I thought it was nice that she did. It shows that she’s aware of patient concerns and doing what she can about it. They see patients for regular appointments but also unscheduled appointments if there is an issue that isn’t severe enough for the ER but still needs to be addressed quickly. This was me on a couple of occasions. I called in the morning on 3 separate occasions and was seen within a couple of hours due to complications with my pregnancy. So I really appreciate being seen so quickly and will take waiting a little bit longer for scheduled appointments because of it. The entire staff is very friendly and attentive. When things got serious with my pregnancy Dr.Voss was on top of it and I couldn’t have asked for better care. Things could have gone a lot worse for a lot of reasons but her quick action due to her vast knowledge made sure that the outcome was best case scenario. She followed up with me a couple of times after everything to make sure I was doing okay and I really felt like she took her time. She spent a considerable amount of time talking with me about everything, which is not always the case with some doctors. Very often I feel rushed when I am seeing a physician so in the situation I was in it was nice to feel like I had her ear and care. I wouldn’t hesitate to come back to Dr. Voss for future pregnancies or any other needs. Thank you so much Dr. Voss ❤️

resp.text: Your thoughts are very much appreciated! Thank you. Sending you and your family the best of wishes 🙏

name: angelia martin
text: I absolutely LOVE Ladies First Med Spa, they are ALL so warm, genuine and welcoming and make you feel special, not just another client. Christy takes extreme pride in her work and strives for optimal results tailored specifically for each of her clients concerns, goals and desires, her enthusiasm is contagious and she is truthful about what to expect and will guide you in making the best decisions to achieve the best results. Dr. Voss wants her patients to feel comfortable, relaxed and happy with any and all services provided, just as much as Christy. They work together as a team and make your experience a very warm and positive one and will go above and beyond to ensure that you have the absolute best experience and results!

resp.text: Thanks so much!!!  We love you and your always lovely smile!!! Your personality warms your path!!!

name: Jessie Holmes
text: I’m honestly surprised at the negative reviews. We had our second child with Doctor Torrence, who is an absolutely amazing woman. We just found out we are pregnant with our third and are excited to be back. The staff have always been kind and helpful, never had any issues in the full 9 months we were there before. They Always returned our calls, always kept us informed. Repeat customers here!

name: Deborah Isler Mercer
text: I went here a few years ago, but switched to my regular physcian so I could get it all done in one place. Well, my physician has left town and I went back to Ladies First last week for my checkup. I saw Haley McDaniel on my visit  and she was great!  She was very professional and didn't seem to be in a rush or act like it was a bother to  answer any questions. Everyone that I encountered there was very nice!

name: DV8
text: Have been friendly and helpful with our first pregnancy , thank you .

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind thoughts.  It is our privilege to care for our pregnant patients and wish the best for our future generations of babies♥️

name: Kaitlyn Bluto
text: There is absolutely no communication on appointments. They call me and when I call back they claim they never called. Then I miss an appointment and they never even told me of that appointment. I just want my results and birth control and that's not even happening. Never go there.

name: Mr. Locke
text:
Years ago, this review would be four stars, however, lately the appointment Times seem to be suggestions. You arrive early, as usual, but don't get seen till an hour or two past the appointment time, despite your appointment time is 30 minutes after the office is opening.

Literally the best time for an appointment is 8:00am, when the office first opens. In that case, you only have to wait twenty to thirty minutes to be seen!

name: Jennifer Simmons
text: Love Dr Voss! Wait times have been long in the past but my last two appointments have been very quick.

resp.text: We are always improving and growing to accommodate wonderful people like you. Thank you for your honest comment.

name: Shametrice Barnett
text: Although Dr. Torrence is my OBGYN I've had the pleasure of seeing Dr. Voss as well. Dr. Torrence has been my physician for over 10 years and I must say she is very attentive, through, and nothing short of amazing. If you're looking for someone to tell you what you want to hear or look at you as just a "number" Dr. Torrence ISN'T THE DOCTOR FOR YOU!! The main thing I admire about Dr. T is the fact that she's genuinely concerned about her patients. I also like if you have any issues and you make Dr. Torrence AWARE she does everything in her power to make it right. The entire staff is phenomenal and truly care about their patients! :)

name: Hannah Staples
text: I had such a great experience with Ladies First. Dr. Voss delivered my son who decided to come 6 weeks early, and she made my birthing experience peaceful and at ease while I was worried about my baby boy coming early.

resp.text: Thank you so much for those kind words! We appreciate you Hannah.

name: Melissa Whigham
text: I will begin by saying Dr. Torrence is a very good doctor but she does not manage her time well.  I got to the office as requested 15 minutes before (2:45) my appointment (3:00).  I was called back to see the doctor at 4:35.  I walked out of the office at 4:50.  Not once did Dr. Torrence apologize about my wait time.  It shows a lack of respect for the patient when you have them wait for 1 1/2 hour for an appointment. This is not the first time this has happened.

resp.text: Dr Torrence is no longer with us at LadiesFirst. We appreciate your business and would like another chance to care for you if you would like to visit us again.

name: Abby Mcneil
text: Run as fast as you can . Long long wait times . Rude nurses . I was crammed in an area with other people to have my weight and BP checked (which should be private) went on a rant saying I need to be checked for diseases even though I’m married ‘because I’m young and there could be risky behavior’  , which was really a slap in the face and embarrassing to me. I left in the same situation I was in before , just $80 less in my pocket and pretty shocked

name: Yvonne Kovalchick
text: I love this office and staff! I have been using their Med Spa services for over a year. Christy is amazing and so informative. Dr Voss is so sweet she really cares about her patients. She has given me cosmetic injections... Botox and Juvederm. She takes her time and really listens to me, carefully addressing my concerns and meeting my expectations. Christy has given me facial treatments, she always makes me feel special. I like knowing that my concerns are their concerns. I would highly recommend Ladies First. ❤

resp.text: Thanks so much!! We appreciate your support of our business and your kind words.  Always let us know how we can serve you better. ♥️♥️

name: Sophia Sage
text: In 2015 I had my son with these doctors. I had previously gone here for my female checkups and had a lovely Dr. When I returned to have my son my Dr. Had moved her practice and I took another one. From day one my new dr. Was looking down her nose at me and generally fat shamed me every chance she got. Being a first time mom I was scared and followed what ever I had been told to the letter. I was given countless tests and had more than a few "inconclusive" results with preeclampsia. In the end I was induced before my due date due to an inconclusive movement test and ended up with an emergency c-section that took me months to bounce back from. For even 2 years after I've suffered from crippling pain in my abdomen. Muscle weakness. In general a longer than 'normal' recovery time. To further the issue a couple of weeks ago I tried to get a check up here to remove my IUD and the nurse was so loud pushy and rude on the phone about discussing my insurance over the phone before I could even make an appointment made me just give up completely. I won't be going back to this place ever again. I don't trust them and from the other reviews I've seen on here, you should reconsider trying them.

name: Asha Voss
text:
I am posting a review of my own practice to not just celebrate over 20 years of private practice in a very difficult healthcare economy and environment but also to celebrate more importantly and MOST importantly my incredible employees who have remained loyal and stunningly amazing. They are the greatest people around. For those who do not appreciate their diligence and hard work I encourage you to take your negative comments elsewhere - as you have absolutely no idea how hard they work and what their stressors are in all parts of their lives. As for my Aesetician - we work together as a team we will always work together as a team as that has always created the most beautiful outcomes for our patients.
Doctors who rush through bruising injections do not create the elaborate beautiful outcomes that I have with Christy - who has achieved the status of master aesthetician- and who spends time understanding the contours and the nuances of need and translating them to me as we work as a team.  This is precise injecting work that I am trained and certified to do - as well as an artistic level of teamwork that I don’t think anyone else achieves especially around this region and therefore anyone who criticizes us has no understanding of what we really do and possibly intends us harm  and ill wishes - which is a very sad (and abysmally low) method of demanding a refund.

We adhere to the strictest guidelines in hygienic standards and we have some of the most creative combinations of med spa packages that are unlike any around as we are not just any MedSpa but we are gynecologic med spa and we have everything female just for you and more ;)

Please take some of the negative comments below as encouragement for us to get better especially with our waiting room time -we run into obstetrical emergencies and take immaculate care of our patients and apologize in advance for waiting room misfortunes. We are constantly taking these as constructive criticism for us to get better as negative as they may seem.

However I do take exception to one very negative comment below as you will see I believe this person has reflected more of her own self explanatory emotional disabilities than anyone else’s. I truly think her calling herself a freak is more of her own reflection of what she has always seen and her obvious lack of self love - areas of improvement I would assume.

name: Margo Battenberg
text: Dr Voss has been my provider for 6 years.  It is always a pleasure to see her.  Dr Voss truly loves her profession and it is felt in her care.  She provides up to date procedures and has added esthetics!  What a great adjunct to help each woman feel their best.  Dr Voss, thank you for being your upbeat, positive self.  You are loved and appreciated!  I highly trust and recommend Ladies First!

resp.text: Thank you !

name: Brittany Galland
text: The people at this facility have no personality. No one is friendly, no one smiles at you, and it certainly doesn't make you feel any less awkward when you're getting your lady bits examined. Definitely will be finding a new gynecologist.

name: Vickie Smith
text:
I've never seen such poor doctors in my life!
When you have a patient in the hospital bleeding a good doctor wouldn't want to release, but Voss & Torrence tried to.

name: Alyson Aplin
text: Dr. Torrence and her staff are amazing!! They go above and beyond for their patients!! Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: lianna mejia
text: My friend is pregnant and goes their she says that were good in the beganing but when she went to her appointment when she was suppose to they were closed. now she can't get them on the phone even when they say are open till 5 Monday thru Friday.

name: Common Sense
text:
Have seen DR Voss for 5 years.  She is always  professional,cheerful,
helpful and informative. Personally work in health care and find there phone, front desk , and room staff courteous and helpful. Wait times are compatible with my other providers, family doctor and specialist. I bring a book or read  the magazines provided. Thank you Dr Voss and Ladies First for providing female  Ob and Gyn services

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Trey Jackson
text: My name is Latoya Nunnally. I have been going here for a few months now and I love it. My doctor is Dr. Torrence and she is simply amazing.I would recommend her to anyone. There are so many negative reviews on here but to each his own because I am very hspph with my doctor and will continue going.

name: eraisys herrera
text:
Honestly Pam Jones and Dr. Voss are the best!!
Update: Oh my god I have to say it again. These doctors are the best. I gave birth the 28th of December and Dr. Voss is such a sweet person and so understanding. She literally went to my room after giving birth everyday to check on me .

resp.text: Thank you so very much!

name: Azucena Hernandez
text: Had a wonderful experience over the phone very helpful and informative !Very friendly !

resp.text: Thank you for your kindness!

name: Jennifer Lee
text: Terrible wait time. Expect to be there for 3 hours or more for a pap smear. My appointment was at 8am (which is when they open). I was third to be seen. At 9:40 I still had not seen dr. Voss. At 9:52 I was seen by the dr, then went for lab work and checked out at 10am. Needless to say the exam was very quick and I didnt have an opportunity to discuss my concerns. Would not recommend.

name: Anna Manley
text:
This place is ridiculous. They prescribed a low dose birth control pill that they knew had reduced effectiveness on overweight women, I am pretty noticeably overweight, and wouldn't give me a straight answer when I asked about it several times. I kept having to play phone tag with the nurse when I was redirected to her line; yet, whenever I got fed up and asked the phone operators to get the nurse, she was there in seconds. All of this after being prescribed a birth control I didn't want that was in such high doses almost everyone on it had side effects.
Besides the never ending phone tag, the waiting times are insane majority of the time. I went to get the last shot in a 3 part series to help prevent cancer, just a shot, never had to see the doctor, anyone could give it to me, but I had to wait TWO hours. They were not full, it wasn't even half full, I just waited while so many people who arrived after me went first. It took a minute or less for that shot. And yes, I had an appointment.
If you value your time or your respect, just find somewhere else.

name: Becky Gavin
text:
I love Dr. Voss but the wait times are just absurd. I’ve never waited this long at a doctors office. Usually wait times are 1-2 hours. Sometimes more than that. The lobby is never crowded, the back doesn’t seem busy. No one is in hurry here.
***Editing my review after my LAST appointment with Dr. Voss.
Coming from someone who has worked in healthcare for eight years, this office is poorly managed. The staff doesn’t care because the Doctor’s don’t care. Simple as that. Ladies, steer clear of Ladies First.

resp.text: Thank you for being a patient of Dr. Asha Voss. We apologize for the long wait time. Sometimes delivery calls our physicians to the hospital. We appreciate your patience when these situations arise.

name: Donna DeVane-Trippe
text: Let me start by saying that I love Dr. Torrence, but the lack of time management has completely done me in. I have had 6 visits in the last year and each time I have had to wait 2 to 2-1/2 hours. One visit i was forgotten about (sitting in the exam room). the next visit 3 patients had the same appt time of 330. When i complained about the long wait times the nurse told me to make early morning appointments.  So my next 2 appointments were the very 1st ones. Both times Dr. Torrence didn't even show up until 45 minutes to an hour after my scheduled appointment. Needless to say I am done. My time is just as valuable as theirs.

name: Sheena Guettler
text: I recently had twins and Dr. Torrance is my doctor.  I would recommend anyone seeking a practical, thorough obgyn to see Dr. T. The nurses and staff have always been courteous. My usual wait time is around 30 minutes.

name: JA Cole
text: Dr. Voss is wonderful. She always takes a lot with me and explains everything! Very knowledgeable and caring!!!

name: Bethany
text: I saw Dr.Voss a few days ago to start a new birth control as a new patient. After reading all the horrible reviews online,I was a little hesitant about keeping my appointment but,decided to proceed and give it a chance. Upon arriving walking in at 11:00am my appt. was at 11:15am, I was a little confused by all the dermatology products and was unsure I was in the correct building until I asked the receptionist who was very polite and helpful. After filling paperwork out for a new patient visit,I was asked to urinate in a specimen cup. I went to the bathroom,sat my cup in the lab window however,I noticed about 6 other cups full of urine with patients names labeled on them as I also work in the medical field,I thought this was VERY dirty and also a HIPPA violation,I proceeded anyways. I was called to the back fairly quickly,there was only one other patient waiting. I was sat down for the nurse to get vitals,then told to sit at the chairs near the lab until I was called. I waited there about 30mins. The nurse then took me to the exam room, as I sat there for at least another hour maybe a little more. I became anxious but,tried to be patient. Dr.Voss walked in,she was very polite however,I felt as soon as she come in and I gave her my reason for seeing her she was showing me all these brochures about weight loss and dermatology products. I weigh 100lbs.,I was not interested in any of this but, listened. She spent about 20mins or so in the room with me she explained everything in great depth and reassured me questions that I worried about were nothing to be concerned about. I then got dressed,went to check out,which was 2:00pm. I had a good experience other than the urine in the bathroom and the long wait time. It wasn't a horrible experience but,I suggest they change some things. I also was concerned that my last period was in February and it is now June,no pregnancy test was done nor was could you pregnant asked, that is a major concern for me even though I knew the answer they didn't seem to ask.

name: Erica Hamilton
text: was talked down to and treated like I didn't matter at all. And since I don't have steady transportation to appointments they found it necessary to make me feel even lower by lecturing me every time I go to the hospital or call their office. I have several severe issues going on with my pregnancy, and I'm not heartless, so OF COURSE I WANT prenatal care!! But not all of us have the money to pay for rides and it is way too far to walk to the office. In my opinion they need SOMEONE there that can identify with the less fortunate and not just cater to those that have everything readily available!

name: Jenna Enfinger
text: Literally the slowest dr office I have ever been to. I waste my whole day here everytime I have an appointment. Their communication skills with their patients also aren't very good.

name: galaxy- king
text: I'm so confused on the negative reviews.... Doctor Torrence is amazing she is always smiling and friendly.... She has preformed a C-section on me twice and I've survived thus far I trust her with my life..... I get the wait times but I believe they are short staffed and births are pretty unpredictable so while it's frustrating on the receiving end of long wait times I understand that if I was in labor I'd want MY doctor to be available.... Maybe they will figure out a better way to handle this in the future..... The nurses and assistants are great always friendly to me and so is the receptionists, the lady who draws blood is as sweet as can be and the same with both ultrasound techs..... I only met doctor voss once at the hospital but she seemed very kind amd took the time to talk to me...I juat adore this whole practice.... Sometimes you have to check people out leaving these bad reviews maybe it's them.with the bad attitudes.... Some of these reviewers give 5 stars to Wendy's, and McDonald's but write a bad review for a busy doctors office I'm not buying it at all.... Probably didn't get there own way is more like it

name: Jessica M
text:
I went for a check up because most sources say you should start going around the age of 16. Nothing was wrong, but I am 20 and thought I was behind. When I arrived, I filled out the paperwork and waited (total time of about an hour). When I saw the doctor she told me I didn't need to do anything until I was 21 and unless I was having problems I didn't need to have anything done. I drove an hour and paid $40 to have someone tell me I didn't need to be there. They asked me my age and if I was having any problems when I made the appointment, so it should have been avoided.

I gave them 3 stars because everyone was really friendly and the facility was very clean.

name: C Moff
text: Very polite staff.  They listen to you.  I love it there.

name: Ashlee Preston
text: The nurse that took my vitals had no personality not real friendly. Been waiting over an hour.. People have to get to work do they not think of that. Why do they make appointments if they dont follow them really

name: Kristen Guidry
text: If you're bored and have all the time in the world this is the right place. If not , I suggest you find somewhere else to go.

name: Alexis Bastidas
text: Worst service ever. Three hours waiting to being seen by the doctor with appointment.

name: c.j. mato-toyela
text: Won't call back after multiple attempts to get in touch.

name: Brittany R
text: I had my daughter with Ladies 1st over 13 years ago. Dr. Torrence was fantastic and the experience was great. When we moved back to the area, I was so excited to return for the same experience. HAH! Should've known better. Dr. Torrence seems to be the only capable staff member, which means you wait for 3+ hours for OB appointments. As I had a child to take care of, I couldn't do that. So I switched to Dr. Voss. Biggest mistake of my life. I tore with a 6 pound baby. So when my 9 pound baby shot out like a freaking rocket because she kept turning up the pitocin, you can only imagine the aftermath. When I went to my 6 week checkup, I asked her why she didn't give me a c-section to begin with since my son was measuring huge, she told me that I was crazy with hormones and if I spoke to her like that again, we'd have to involve lawyers. I immediately switched to Dr. Heim whom when he saw the size of my son could not believe that I had him vaginally. These women are running a chop shop and I'm not sure why they are the first practice that Tricare refers to. I'm guessing it's probably because they need the business once people realize how shady they are. Do your research and AVOID, AVOID, AVOID!!!!!

name: kelsey mardis
text: Sadly, I have to agree with all of the other negative reviews. My appointment was at 1:00, I got there at 12:20, and didn't get called back until almost 2:30. I met with my Doctor for 2 minutes (literally) and she had to leave to go to the hospital. No biggie, but the way the other nurses handled the situation pissed me off. They popped in 10 minutes after she left to tell me that someone would be with me in 15-20 minutes! After I already waited almost 2 hours to be seen. I got up and walked out. The customer service was HORRIBLE. I called my insurance and changed doctors immediately.

name: Alexis Boykin
text: They are the slowest . Had an appointment at 9:45 got there at 9:30 because they ask you to be there 15 minutes early for paperwork. I literally walked out of that place at 1:40 and all I was only getting was a freaking pap and breast exam that took all of 5 minutes ! Will not be going back

name: Salman Imtiaz
text: Too too much wait time...its third time that we had to wait 2 long hrs before dr. Came to see us for 5 mins even though we had appointment and the nurses just kept on saying 5 mins every time we asked...poor service and waste of time and at the end dr. Came in hurry just for 5 mins...

name: Nate (NateDog)
text: The wait times are too long. Dr.  Voss is incredibly rude. They have no respect for anyones schedules.  They dont want to work with people that have transportation issues.  I have never been talked to so disrespectful by a dr in my life.  She refused to give me the ultrasound that i know i am due for Because I verified with another obgyn that my insurance does cover it at this set week in my pregnancy. She was very nasty to me and to make it worse in front of my children.

name: Cinnamon Clarke
text: I've been going to ladies first off and on for the last couple years, and the experience has been pretty ok in the pass...but today I seen doctor Voss and I can honestly say this was my last time coming here...she made me feel like she was not caring, she was trying to hurry and get to the next patient, and just didn't have the best attitude,  I didnt feel like she really cared about what I felt day to day....however I love doctor candice short, she is awesome! She has a heart and understands what ppl go threw...And if I did recommend anyone to go here it would be to see doctor candice short ❤..but I would not reccomend doctor Voss,  i dont think she really cares

name: Paige Dewberry
text: Absolutely horrible. They made me change my appointment from August 22 to the 28th cause of their dr and I’ve been waiting an hour since my appointment time to even get out of the stupid waiting area. They have no concept of time and that some people do not take off a full day for a morning appointment.

name: Ashley Lamb
text: I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy.  I feel bad giving them 1 star.  I saw Dr. Raines who I don't believe is there anymore (I wonder why).  I can't speak for all the women that work here but the ones that I encountered came across as very  condescending.  I felt very uncomfortable.  Dr. Raines didn't seem to listen or act like she wanted to answer my questions.  I would see her in the back while they were taking my vitals and she wouldn't  even speak to me. I'v heard several horror stories about this place and am very surprised they are still in business. They told me they would mail my yearly pap smear results.  I never received them and had to call to find out.  They then told me that I had to come in for the results like something was wrong.  I came in and had to pay another copay.  Then Dr. Raines proceeds to ask me why I am there.  Really??!!  Then she says my results were fine.  In my opinion, it was like they wanted another copay from me. I now see Dr. Scott at Women's Medical Center and he is the best.  He has been a blessing to me and it is such a relief to have a DR that sincerely cares.  Come to find out I had a large cyst on my ovary that had to be surgically removed and have PCOS which they never detacted. I recommend you go elsewhere.  And if you read the reviews for this place, I am not the only one!

name: Sonny Gilbert
text: The lady at check in is rude....we are currently sitting here waiting to be seen...coming up on a 1hr....got here 45 mins early and still waited a hour past my wifes appointment....asked the lady upfront what was going on and the only response was ill see....no response back...so really rude and dis courteous staff....

name: lunarxraindrop
text: Definitely not doing business here again!

name: Bebstee b
text: Im 31 years old and pregnant with my first child. Im currently seeing Sharon Bush but i will be finding somewhere else to go. Its almost as if she is looking down on you the moment she walks into your room. The place has treated me like im nothing more than a waist of their time. I would encourage any first time mothers to go somewhere else. Rude staff and cold hearted physician. *update* being that I was so far along I decided to stay with Ladies First. I will never use them in again. At six months I began having pain in my lower back hip and leg. I called the office countless time and mentioned it to Dr. Bush and her nurse only to be treated like I was a bother. it took me being seen by Dr. Malone (while Bush was on vacation) to learn that I was having sciatic nerve issues. Dr. Malone said she would recommend Bush set me up with physical therapy. I mentioned physical therapy to Bush at my follow up appointment only to be told" I never heard of pregnant women doing physical therapy". Then out of nowhere I received a phone call from a therapy center letting me know ladies first had sent a referral *tada* three weeks before my due date. I went to one appointment and the therapist was shocked that they waited so late to finally send me and stated that there was not much (if anything) they could do for me. not to mention that it was not safe for me to do physical therapy do far into my pregnancy. on the day of my due date I went in for my check up. I told the medical assistant that I was having minimal fetal movement she just said ok and left the room. Bush came in assessed me and we discussed induction. I left the office only to be call back to return. When I spoke to Bush She said that she was unaware that I told the medical assistant a having minimal movement from my baby. (do they not communicate with one another??) I was sent for a BPP an was informed that I would be induced that day due to low amniotic fluids. these women for the receptionist to the nurse practitioners to the physicians care nothing about their patients. I would not recommend this place to my worse enemy.

name: Amanda Brockway
text: I am due with my first baby in 3 weeks, I have been seeing Dr. Voss and Lisa Gowan....and amazing midwife...at their Enterprise office my entire pregnancy.  The doctors, nurses, staff, and midwife are friendly, professional, and knowledgeable.  I am absolutely in love with Lisa Gowan, she provides amazing care, takes time to answer all of my questions, and innovative with her practice.  I am fortunate enough to be a part of her new group care classes that she recently started.  Once a month pregnant women, at all stages of their pregnancy, get together to discuss important information and stages of pregnancy (like nutrition, exercise, and changes in your body, experiences, and concerns).  They teach you to take your own blood pressure, Lisa measures your belly and listens to the baby's heartbeat, we sit down and talk as a group for about 2 hours, oh and did I mention free food and snacks?!?! It doesn't get any better for a pregnant lady's doctor appointments :).  It is really a great opportunity to network with other pregnant women and form a support network.  I only wish she could deliver my baby, she is working on getting approval to deliver in the Wiregrass...just won't be done in time for my little one.  I have enjoyed my health care with this group of doctors and I hope you do too.

name: Ashley Andrews
text: dr Voss and all the nurses have taken great care of me during My last surgery and have taking the time to explain exactly what to expect during my upcoming da Vinci hysterectomy I love then all and highly recommened I had not been to an ob since I was 18 and I'm 35 and she was very gentle she could sense my nervousness and they kept my husband up to date while I was in surgery so he wouldn't b worried. you won't b ashamed if u give them a try thank you dr Voss and entire staff

name: Bee Tee
text: Best doctors. Friendly service.

name: LaNae Allen
text: It should be called money first. They don't care about their patients, they only care about their wallets.

name: Carolyn FRANCO
text: Love there service

name: New Generation
text: Disrespectful and the wait is to long

name: Danna Britt
text: Wonderful

name: J Williams
text: Transferred to him at 28 weeks. He has a good spirit. My baby would move when he talked. He gave us good information and made us feel like more than just another birth on his list. I had some complications during labor and he really checked up on me and did an amazing job on my cesarean. Still in the healing process, but my partner says the scar is small and looks good. His staff is also sweet and the lactation consultant was amazing! Life changer.

name: Kelsey Brand
text: He is amazing! Very kind and thoughtful. He makes sure you understand everything and answers any and all questions you have. Ive never felt rushed in our apps.

name: Obviously Interesting
text: Dr.Johannson was incredibly attentive to all of my baby’s needs,as well as my own. He listened to any thoughts or concerns I had at any point & also made sure I was not just medically cared for,but also cared for as an individual with concerns & issues. I’m so fortunate to have had him as my physician,& will definitely use him in the future!

name: Jessi Weatherspoon
text: I will never use anything ob/gyn! The entire staff here is amazing, comforting and understanding!

name: Anna Weathers
text: One of the best. I am so thankful for my experience with Dr. Johannson.

name: Melissa Tomlin
text: Doctor Johansson was down to earth and he tried to make you feel as comfortable as possible. He completely explains everything that is going to be done and is very informative. I would highly recommend him to any of my female friends. Glad I was told about him. His staff was just as friendly and caring as he is.

name: Tim Carson
text: I am Tim Carson’s wife Lisa Bradley. I cannot express just how wonderful the whole staff is. Dr. Johannson is probably the very best Drs I’ve ever seen and trust me I’ve seen a lot being a cancer patient.  Thank y’all for all you do ! Lisa

name: Kristin Stamm
text: Dr. Johannson and his side kick made me feel comfortable during my visit. They were very friendly and detailed with explaining all the I needed to know. Everyone at Cheaha Women’s Health center are welcoming and seem sincere to their patients. I’m very happy with my decision in going there regularly. Thankful beyond words! I highly recommend all women to come here.

name: Jessi Turner
text: I’ve been seeing Dr. Johannson for almost 8 years now, & he has delivered both of my children. He & his staff are always helpful, & pleasant. He is very compassionate, has a wonderful bedside manner, & always considerate of his patients. We love him & his office!

name: Maggie Kristina Cavitt
text: Dr. Johannson is an amazing doctor and his staff are incredible!  I switched to him halfway through my pregnancy, and he ordered additional ultrasounds based upon my previous son's development that my old OB didn't.  I am so grateful that Dr. Johannson and his staff listened to my concerns and provided me with comprehensive medical care.  The receptionists were so sweet and the nurse, Maria, was very through.  They make you feel cared for, rather than just another number.

name: Charlotte Moody
text: Dr. Johannson and his staff are so friendly and amazing!! I was nervous about seeing a male OB, but he made me feel so comfortable. He is so nice and has a very good bedside manner. He delivered my daughter and he will be my doctor for all of my future children. I chose him because he advertises to be pro natural, vbac births, and breastfeeding. He is very supportive of all of those things and he will help you achieve them. His staff are very thorough and they care about their patients. They make sure that you are properly taken care of and don't cut corners even if they are running behind. 5 stars all the way!

name: Summer Kelley
text: Super sweet staff! Felt comfortable and welcome. Would absolutely refer my friends and clients.

name: Felicia Sarhal (Baker)
text: Dr Johannson was very nice and made me feel very comfortable and it was only my first appointment with him. I can already tell that he will be the DR that I stick with!

name: Jessica Elders
text: Dr. J is absolutely amazing! I went to several other ob/gyns trying to find someone that would listen to what I was going through and they always brushed me off. Dr. J is the first one that took my concerns seriously. Hands down would definitely recommend.

name: Alesha Orman
text: Dr. Johansson is a great doctor. Very friendly and professional. His staff are outstanding. Just today his assistant was so friendly and it felt like visiting old friends. They are always punctual which I appreciate. If you are looking for a doctor this one gets 10 out of 10.

name: Michael Veach
text: I am writing for my Vietnamese wife; who is not comfortable with her English. She is saying “He is so nice. He took time to listen to my concerns about vitamins. He checked my blood and gave me Vitamin D. I like a doctor who listens to me even if I do not speak good language.” As her husband, I also appreciated his focusing on her; allowing her to get her message across. It says a great deal about the man. He also delivered out first grandchild, my daughter thinks he is great as well.

name: Kimberly Rudd
text: Dr. Johansson and his office staff were very nice. They took the time to explain the procedure being done and what to expect during and after. The only downside to the whole visit was the wait time. I wasn't seen until an hour past my appointment time.

name: Ashley Daniel
text: This was  my grandmother's  first visit and they were phenomenal! So patient and  helpful! I really am so grateful!

name: Jillian Freeland
text: I am a doula and I have seen Dr. J support my clients and he is amazing!!! But today I was able to experience his support (non pregnancy related) and he was so incredible. He didn’t just work to fix my symptoms, but he dug deeper to consider what was causing the issues. Also his staff was super sweet!!!

name: Kate Miller
text: Amazing practice run by amazing people. They are professional, timely, knowledgeable, and they truly care about your health. Dr Johannson is one-in-a-million. He has delivered all 4 of our children and has helped us to have wonderful birth experiences each time. We are so grateful to him and this practice for the care they have shown our family!

name: Marsha Hammonds
text: Has great beside manners and very thorough in addressing my health issues.

name: Katie Hurst
text: Dr. J and his staff always go above and beyond to make sure you get the best care possible!! Everyone is always friendly and helpful!!

name: Danielle Duffey
text: I really enjoyed my first experience with this doctor. As a woman most females wouldn’t want to see a male gynecologist. After seeing him I wouldn’t want to see another woman. He made me feel very comfortable as far as discussing my problems like I had known him for years. His staff was very friendly and welcoming with my two young children.

name: Krystal Railey
text: He is a wonderful man that takes time to explain things to you. He wants to know the answer to any problem and will find the answer to help you. Highly recommend.

name: Jessi Cobb
text: Dr. J and his staff are amazing! They’re compassionate, as well as extremely informative. You are spoken to with respect and things are explained well so that they’re easily understood. Dr. Johannson has been the first OB/GYN to care about my general wellness, alongside of my gynecological needs. I will not go to another one as long as we are lucky enough to have him in our area!

name: Kelsy Plummer
text: I love Dr. J and his sweet staff! All three of my babies were delivered by him and he is by far the most genuine, down to Earth, and informative Dr. that I have ever witnessed. I could not imagine going to anyone else. I 1000% recommend him for any OBGYN care that you need.

name: Kaitlin Patterson
text: So glad we decided Dr. Johannson was who we wanted to use as our OBGYN! His office staff and lactation consultant is phenomenal as well!

name: Kayla Hodges
text: If you’re looking for a practice that truly encompasses the meaning of family then look no further!  Dr. Johannson and the staff at Cheaha Women’s Health & Wellness go above and beyond to truly get to know their patients and whether you don’t want to have kids or you’re having your 7th, each patient is treated with a level of care that surpasses any other facility in the area!  I have had 2 children and am so proud for them to be a part of the Cheaha Women’s Health & Wellness family!

name: Ashley Siskey
text: Attentive, excellent bedside manner - makes me feel comfortable. Professional but not stuffy, which is always a plus. The staff are friendly and helpful, which creates an experience of being a person, not just an appointment. I have zero reservations recommending Cheaha.

name: Tiffany Bean
text: This whole team is so WONDERFUL & So caring. I would recommend Dr. Johannson to anyone. Great Doctor!

name: Cara Fagan
text: Best OBGYN. Listens to every concern I have, found issues that other OB’s ignored.

name: Na'cole Shears
text:
The staff is great very friendly and welcoming, Dr. Johansson is very attentive, listens, and he makes you feel comfortable. I was seen in a timely manner no long wait.
I very much enjoy my visits and I've told several friends as well as family members of how great the staff is.

name: Kendra C.
text: Dr. Johansson is fantastic! Very personable while still maintaining his professionalism. Willing to take the time to listen to any concerns you may have and help find the proper treatment plan. Highly recommend!

name: Elivia Cortinas
text: Dr. J and his staff are amazing. I was set on having a waterbirth. After getting GD I worked hard with exercise and diet to keep it under control. He advocated for me with the hospital to still be able to have my wish of a waterbirth. Unfortunately I had to be induced and wasn't able to get my wish but his actions left a lasting impression.

name: Valerie Vaughan
text: I had a wonderful experience with Dr. J and his entire staff at Cheaha Women’s. I traveled 2.5 hours for their care and it was well worth it to have such a supportive birth experience as well as prenatal care.

name: Nicole Osbourn
text: Dr. J is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! He has been my doctor since last june. Because of him I have lost 50+ pounds and ended needing a hysterectomy. He gave me my life back! I am so much happier & healthier thanks to Dr. J an his staff!

name: Glenda Britton
text: He is a wonderful physician who cares for his patients who has much knowledge in the medical field he has an excellent staff who gives you all the attention you need makes you feel very welcome.

name: Joshualand Pleasant-Bey
