name: Hunter Thompson
text: Dr. Sylvester was great at my wife's prenatal care, but she really shined during the labor, and delivery. She recommended a C-section after an unproductive labor. We trusted her, and after the birth, she let us know the cord was around his neck and was very necessary. I would recommend her to anyone. She is a great Doctor

name: Michelle Staggs
text: Wonderful nurses and staff! Dr Sylvester has made this pregnancy feel like a breeze! They have been absolutely amazing at working with me when i am unable to make it to an appointment! Highly recommend 5/5!

name: Anauj Darlington
text: I really loved Jacqueline i've been going to her since I was 16 she handled my first pregnancy perfectly and made me so happy when she delivered my son. But she has definitely changed since then. I had a miscarriage back in December she did not act like she cared, I had to go to the hospital to get some help even though when I got there the hospital told me I should've went to my doctor since there isn't much they can do. This month I found out I was pregnant again.. I had an appointment Wednesday I get there and it's just patients sitting outside in their car but there's no sign of her or her staff. I found out that they didn't show because it was suppose to storm (you would think they would've called and rescheduled with people). So I start bleeding like I did my last miscarriage and I couldn't call since it was the weekend so I went to the hospital. They told me to follow up with her to see what's going on. I call them to actually reschedule my appointment that they didn't show up to. The secretary told me my appointment would be MARCH 29th.. I'm over here in pain, bleeding, and mind going crazy and their saying I have to wait a whole week for an appointment I already had but didn't get because they didn't show up! Well I found another OBGYN yesterday and got an appointment TODAY.. I got all my questions answered, may be heartbroken I am losing my baby but at least my mind is at peace knowing what's going on with my body. Instead of sitting around thinking of every worst case scenario.

name: K G
text:
Dr Sylvester is the best OB doctor ever!!!
She is professional, compassionate, clean and very knowledgeable! Her nurses and office staff are caring, helpful and very welcoming. I’ve been a patient of hers for 10 years and  there has never been a time, she didn’t come through for me. She’s successfully performed my surgeries, delivered my baby and relieved me of pain and stress! Thank you Dr Sylvester! You are truly heaven sent 🙂

name: Tremel Horton
text: I love Sylvester Jacqueline MD facility and what she does for maternity women. About 8 months ago Dr Sylvester was delivering my son, she was very kind, understanding and very patient. I loved her humor during the process, she made sure that i was comfortable and happy and if i wasn't she sure knew how to crack a smile on my face. Out of all OBGYNs I've encountered Sylvester was the upmost BEST ONE I felt safe and secured around her delivering my child and i trust that she does a wonderful job and making sure all babies are come into this world clean and healthy. She is a true blessing from God for babies and pregnant woman. Thank you so much for such a great experience.

name: rena Will
text: I love her and her staff, they are sooo nice and very professional, I have been a patient there about 10 years. I recently moved to Nashville, and I refuse to see an OB in Nashville, Tn. Yes I make the trip because she is an awesome doctor.

name: Marleeta Harris
text: Dr. Sylvester is Awesome!!!!! Great service and staff and they’re so welcoming. I definitely recommend her!! She’s the best❤️🤗

name: Cheryl Austin
text: Dr. Sylvester was competent and open-minded.  However, the wait in her office was extraordinarily long (almost 2 hours!) which is why I did not give her 5 stars.  She listens and spent enough time with me.  Office staff (check-in, appointments, etc.) were good.

name: Vee Morris
text: Staff is amazing friendly and professional. Dr. SYLVESTER heard all my concerns and addressed. Very professional and relatable if you can say that about your obgyn...lol!

name: Sabrina Bush
text: Dr. Sylvester and her entire team are wonderful people! All my prenatal check ups and my birth were amazing (I ended up having to have a c-section) and the surgery Dr. Sylvester performed was TOP-NOTCH!! I highly recommend her!

name: Lakesha Stewart
text: Wonderful Doctor and staff!! They make you feel important and comfortable. The office hours are very convenient and they are very accommodating. I hate I am moving to a different state and have to find a new office. If I could take them with me I would.

name: Latonya Woods
text: Dr. Sylvester has truly been a blessing in my life. She was attentive to my needs and she also did a great job with my surgery. She is highly favored and gifted in her craft of taking care of myself and others. Thank you!

name: kelsea Donaldson
text: I love this place! I've been going here since 2006! The staff is so loving and caring and i love it!!

name: J Wilson
text: I'm 11 weeks with my first child. I have seen Dr. Sylvester for over two years and didn't have any problems prior to the pregnancy. However, I have had significant issues since then. I'm not anti-medicine, surgery, etc. but always felt condemned for wanting a natural childbirth by her. Additionally, her billing staff are disorganized, unprofessional, and I had charges on my account for services I did not yet receive. When I tried to address this, the billing manager became hostile and canceled my appointment that I had been waiting already an hour for. I think they are a great place if all you want is an annual, but not for delivering children. I just recently transferred to another doctor and will not be returning. Also, they do not know how to work with HRAs (health reimbursable accounts) if that is important to you. I don't mean this as a slight, but I think they work with mostly Medicaid customers so I felt they did not understand how to work with BCBS insurance. The receptionist even suggested that I should apply for Medicaid if I am eligible to avoid paying my deductible. Finally, the ultimate reason why I decided to transfer to another doctor was that the appointments were very short and she didn't seem to have time to fully answer questions or explain her reasoning for prescriptions (in my case, antibiotics during pregnancy).

name: Eve Hambrick
text: Finding out I was pregnant for the fourth time was one of the most devastating experiences I have had. For I had lost two prior because of an incompetent cervix. My third pregnancy, which resulted in a live birth, still did not give me enough Hope to see a positive pregnancy test a good thing. I did not rush to a physician because the pregnancy had already shown I was losing this baby too. My sister had Dr. Jacqueline Sylvester as her prenatal physician and recommended her. I scheduled the appointment and long behold my body was rejecting this pregnancy as well. Dr. Sylvester scheduled surgery for the next morning. The surgery was for a cervical cerclage to close the premature dilated cervix. The surgery went perfect, I only missed a day of work. The dreading days leading to the infamous 16 week mark was lighten by her elated spirit at my appointments. Walking in the exam room saying, "We are making it." Every week and every appointment she walked in with the same energy saying the same thing, "We are making it." Dr. Sylvester was not there when I lost my first two. But just that sentence and that energy made me feel less alone this last pregnancy. She made me feel like I had her support and it comforted me. Although I still hadn't come to terms that this baby would make it she made me feel for twenty minutes the baby had a chance. I carried what is now my last child for 37 weeks. I had never made to what you call a full term birth. I had a beautiful healthy 6lb 14oz baby girl. Because Dr. Sylvester did not give up on me even after seeing how my body had given up on itself. The joy of having her deliver my miracle was the best ending a troubled mother could ask for. Dr. Sylvester was able to be with me full circle on the biggest miracle I've seen GOD do so far. I knew GOD had introduced to me Hope with my third. But my Faith grew with the help of Dr. Sylvester with my fourth. Thank you for being my doctor and thank you for reminding me how far Faith the size of a mustard seed will go. GOD Bless!

name: Karnice Holloway
text: Dr. Jacqueline Sylvester is an exceptional OB/GYN, she has been my physician since 2003 and she performed my surgery and it was seamless, the healing time was one week instead of six weeks because of robotic surgery. She is a very skilled physician with a positive attitude and always very personable. She has a beautiful convenient office with a friendly staff and late hours on Thursday. I highly recommend her!

name: Angel Warren
text: New patient. It did take a very long time to get an appointment, however no longer than any other place in this area. Dr. Sylvester nurse listened to my concerns. After that Dr. Sylvester came in a really listened. I was very satisfied.

name: GloJean Aldridge
text: Just ran across this comment section. She clipt my daughters intestine, we didn't know until the baby was about 2 weeks old, although my daughter called complaining about pain, and went in the office they sent her home, saying it's just because she just had the baby, after she couldn't eat and throwing up, took her to emergency room to find out this horror. I feel Sylvester owes my daughter. She stayed in the hospital for 2 months. It took a lot of prayers, plus  transferred to another hospital. A lot of pain and torture, I had a new born, plus had to be off work.

name: Sherita Moses
text: An outstanding gynecologist!!! I would recommend Dr. Sylvester for any female concerns, and especially if you're having a baby!!! Very thorough AND professional!

name: Emilyy Lynn
text: When I first saw this place I was a little iffy because it seemed a bit shady where it was located and playing phone tag a couple of times in the beginning frustrated me (but what can you expect on holiday weekends lol), but after I got to know everyone I love it. I have really enjoyed my time with her and her staff. They are always kind to me on every visit, they work fast to get you in and out. The only time I have ever felt unwelcome or frustrated was when she was out on an emergency and had her nurse practitioner take her appointments for her, she was a bit rude...  But other than that I believe Dr.  Sylvester is a great ob,  I absolutely love her  and her staff! Her lab techs and nurses are almost always in a great mood and go over the top to make you feel as comfortable as possible while in their care. She's made me feel pretty great about how things have gone for me with this being my first child, I'm pretty pleased to have her as my ob and I'd definitely recommend her to anyone new to the mommy business. 😊

name: Darlene Richardson
text: I have been with Dr. Sylvester since 2005. She is kind, loving, professional, and an excellent doctor. I refer everyone I know. Please check her out. And I love her staff.

name: Tanisha Brown
text:
Dr. Sylvester is an Awesome Doctor...she performed my robotic surgery and my healing time was only a week....I was up walking the
Next day... her staff is wonderful as well!!

name: E. Nicole Campbell
text: Dr. Sylvester is awesome! I have been seeing her since I moved to Huntsville in 06. She's so attentive, and you can really tell that she cares for her patients. No other OB/GYN will do while she's practicing.

name: Veronica Dennis
text: I've had great experience with Dr. Sylvester. The wait times can get long but other than that everyone is quite professional and friendly. For 10 years, I have always enjoyed her and her staff.

name: Samantha Johns
text: Dr Sylvester has delivered and provided prenatal care to me during all of my pregnancies my last pregnancy she was not thorough and she did not take proper precautions my youngest son gained a brachial plexus injury due to her neglect i had complained several times i felt like something was stuck in side my stomach and it felt like someone was scratching my insides complaint was ignored and now my son will forever have to live with this challenging disability. My heart breaks every single day seeing my sons arm and knowing they had proper tools to ensure that the complaint was taken care of when we brought my son home all he did was cry all the time because of the pain which lead to him having to have medications and physical therapy Birmingham visits for botox etc dr sylvester acted like it was just another day and went on about her business mean while my tiny infant son suffered pain etc it is scary that she can continue to deliver babies knowing what she has caused for my son and our family and not only for my family but.for another family as well except the other child has more serious injuries and again she did nothing. Shows no remorse just continues to collect a check now that my son is almost two im finally in a space that i feel comfortable sharing this story we till this day still carry on with dr appointments etc while this lady lives a normal life

name: Nae
text:
I came to babies Etc half way through my pregnancy and I was greeted with a polite and organized staff . Dr. Jacquline was very professional and informal , one of the sweetest doctors I have ever had . She is very persistent with her customers and hands on I would recommend her to anyone .

great service and staff

name: Rosetta Jones
text: I feel safe and it feels like family everytime I vist

name: Keianna Davis
text: I truly wish I could give this so called OBGYN 0 stars. Let me start by saying I only visited this place 2 times and I'm already no longer a patient here. First off I was FORCED to get an pap smear and  I let it be known that it was my first time getting one done. I was extremely uncomfortable during the examination and was literally screaming for the nurse to stop and the only thing she kept telling me was to "relax". If a patient orders you to stop that means STOP. Secondly, it took almost a month for me to get the "results back from the pap smear, and they only called me back because my mom had to call and remind them. It's almost impossible to get a call back. The nurse Amanda that called me last week to so called give the results from my forced pap smear sounded like she was half dead. After telling my mom about the called she called back and demanded to speak with Dr. Sylvester, Sylvester came up with any excuse as to why we couldn't get call backs in a timely manner, she went on to say my paper work was siting on her desk for 3 weeks but she just didn't get around to doing it.WRONG ANSWER. She began to over speak my mom saying that we needed to find another doctor that would suit us. This Place is a total JOKE. Forced pap smears, rude nurses and a lazy unprofessional doctor.... doesn't get any better than that right? Beware of this place !!! I really wish I had've looked up the reviews for this dump. Sylvester sets a bad example for African American run OBGYNs she is a disgrace.

name: maria vinson
text: Dr. Jaqueline Sylvester has been my OB/GYN doctor for almost 8 years.  She performed a uterine thermal ablation 8 years ago and recently completed a hysterectomy.  Throughout the entire time I have seen Dr. Sylvester she has been professional, knowledgeable and most importantly, competent.  I had factors that complicated my procedures but received excellent care with Dr. Sylvester! I do and will recommend her to friends, family and coworkers.  You could not be in better hands if you use Dr. Jaqueline Sylvester.

name: Anna Clevenger
text: I have been seeing Dr. Foster and he is wonderful, but his appointment schedulers (or lack there) of are terrible. I have tried on 6+ different occasions to speak to someone and get an appointment and also filled out my information on their website to contact me and no one did. I wanted to stay with my doctor because I trust him for when I have kids in the future, but due to not being able to get an appointment I am having to change offices. Someone needs to get some control over this problem.

name: Holly Wood
text: I have used Dr Foster for about 20 years. He is very knowledgable and caring. He takes time, after each  exam  to sit down in his office and go over everything, asking questions and explaining.

name: Kaitlynn O'Donnell
text: I would absolutely give zero stars if I could. The office staff is horrible, Melissa in particular. The doctors are even worse they don’t care about you or your baby. Please go anywhere but here. Also, the office is dirty and they do not wash their hands.

name: Tawny
text: I'd give zero stars if I could. I went back in December for my annual which is suppose to be covered by my insurance and was charged $65 even when a normal copay is $40. I had them run some tests which cost me close to $400 and had the same test run by a walk in clinic just months later and never received a bill for it. I was told by the walk in clinic someone with their office probably coded it wrong which is why I received a bill. While there we discussed birth control options and Gardasil (which is something they have pushed both times I have been there). While I was interested in both I asked about cost and what insurance might cover, etc and was told she wasn't an insurance guru and I would have to contact my provider and get back with them. This was upsetting because I was being sold something I both wanted and needed but yet could not be told what it would cost and would have to come back and pay another copay once I figured that out. Not to mention I had coworkers that have gone to other medical professionals for various reasons and they have never had an issue with someone letting them to know what to expect with or without insurance. Any questions I had I felt were met with luke warm interest about as equivalent as a shoulder shrug. While I know the ultimate decision is left up to myself I asked for opinions based on their expertise and knowledge and got little to nothing in return. My pap smear came back abnormal and the medicine that was called in seemed to only give symptoms versus relieving any which I never had to start and ended up having to go to the walk in clinic for them to prescribe me something to get rid of it. I returned the other day for an unrelated issue and the staff, as usual, was unwelcoming. It reminded me of going to the DMV where you pull a number and wait to hear "Next". After I gave the reason for my visit to 2 different people I can hear them in the hallway discussing what to me is a very private situation and it was a busy day so I know other patients could hear them which only added to the embarrassment, stress and anxiety I was already feeling. After my examination I was again given options for treatment and Gardasil was pushed (which, once again I would have been all for) but was told they could not check to see what my insurance would cover and would need to contact my provider to find out and return if I decided to go with that option. The PA looked down at her watch at one point making me feel like she didn't have time to spend with me to answer questions. In those situations you don't always know what to ask and I know they see the same thing day in and day out but we as patients don't so I don't feel like it's a lot to take the time to educate your patients on what they are facing. I shouldn't have to learn more from google than I do from my healthcare professional. At the end of it all the medicine was never called into my pharmacy. I made a trip to pick it up to find out they had not received it and when I called the following morning to check the office told me it had not been sent over but they were doing so then. I asked if they could send it to one closer to me and was told I could call the pharmacy and have them transfer it. I called the pharmacy later in the day to check and still no prescription and their office has already closed. I will not be returning and my advice to anyone who is seeking a facility that is warm, welcoming and nonjudgmental and a doctor who listen and cares for you to find somewhere else to go other than here.

name: Dennise Scott Earnest-King
text: I was so put off by the office workers' unprofessional attitudes and uncouth behavior. It was just trashy. Honestly, I didnt want to see what was next to come. So I left before I ever saw an actual physician. I heard some things I never thought I would hear in a Dr's office. Wow. Ladies shouldn't trash talk other ladies; especially patients of the facility. Needless to say, I Won't be going back. This place needs to hire a new crew!

name: Mary Carson Bond
text: OBGYN Associates of Alabama has a great staff and doctors. Recommend going here for all you OB/GYN needs. You cannot go wrong!

name: Chi Quetta
text:
2/10/2020
I called Dr. Rupa Goolsby office and spoke with Jill. I explained that I understand that Dr. Goolsby normally does not see patients who are expecting until they are 8 weeks but the ER physician I saw 2/9 advised that because I had been experiencing bleeding and the ultrasound still showed some bleeding, I needed to be seen within 1 or 2 days. Jill told me that Dr. Goolsby doesn’t like to see patients until they are 8 weeks along. She then went on to tell me that there is really “nothing that we can do”. Jill asked “Well the ER doctor said everything is okay, right?” I told her, “NO. He did not. He told me that I needed to be seen within 1 to 2 days and that is why I am calling now.” Jill said, “Well I just don’t want to put this in and Dr. Goolsby wonders why I scheduled this and your just 7 weeks.” Jill told me that she could add me to the calendar to be seen on 2/14 because then I’d be “at the end of my 7th week”.

I was able to be seen by a doctor with Sparks & Favor at Brookwood Medical who worked me in with no problem. They explained to me that for some doctors, the standard is 8 weeks gestation BUT advised when a patient is having complications such as mine, they are treated as a priority.

If you want to be treated with care and consideration, do NOT go to Dr. Rupa Goolsby clearly she nor her staff truly care. Don’t allow her to get 10 months of money from your health insurance company when she clearly does not truly care.

name: Unlimited Wireless
text:
Great doctors, but the support staff are absolutely horrific. All the way from the nurses to the administrative staff,  ESPECIALLY the office manager Melissa. SO rude,  judgemental, hypocritical,  and down right uncaring and insensitive.
It completely undermines the doctors' compassionate care and dedication  to treat women's specific health needs throughout
each phase of their lives...Saddest part? It is the gang of hypocritical femininazis who are ruining every good and ethical belief the practice  was  built upon.

name: Veronica Wiggins
text: I have used Dr. Benton for more than 5 years and she is awesome, she was amazing through out my entire pregnancy and then post par-tum care, she has always be very honest about anything i may need to do as far as my health is concerned.

name: Peggy
text: I Am a long time patient of Dr Foster.  Excellent knowledge of understanding of each phase of women's bodies.  Takes care of all age groups. Very good listener, gives honest feedback.  I trust him totally. I like the way he can pick up on other health issues offering expert help.

name: Yosha Saffo
text: I love Dr.Goolsby! She is very professional and  courteous. I've been a patient of hers for a few years and I have no complaints.

name: i r
text: If you're sitting there reading a bunch of patient reviews, trying to find a right doctor for you, scared about the news that you need a surgery, know that you are not alone. I used all of the tools at my discretion and asked all my friends to find the right gynecologist for me. Thankfully, I found Dr.  Rupa Goolsby! She is a rare gem of a physician. Run (don't walk) to go see her! Due to her exemplary level of expertise, she can offer what others can't. Currently, I am recovering from my surgery faster than expected. No complications at all, average blood loss, no post-surgery bleeding, no infections and I attribute that solely to Dr. Rupa Goolsby’s high level skill and care.  Besides being an incredibly competent doctor and expert in her field, Dr. R. Goolsby is an extremely genuine and warm person. Thank you, Dr. R. Goolsby!!

name: Carrie Nemo
text: She is amazing and very detail... My experience was awesome I will be going back.

name: lady foxx
text: I did not have a good experience she was very dry and short with me then i had to remind her that i needed a yearly breast and pelvic ezam she lookd as id she dreaded doing it also she ia never on time i waited close to two hours every time before i was seen and the nurse had the nerve to tell me i was late which i was about 15 mins early i would not recommend her work on a dog dr. Shinneareer

name: Grayson Ann Stephens
text: Honestly, I’ve never worked for anyone that cared about their patients as much as Dr. John Foster does. I have worked in healthcare for ten years and have never met someone who cared and is as knowledgeable as he is.

name: lynn grammer
text: Great environment, nice, friendly and clean, Dr. Gollsby real good Dr. I will be going there for all of my female issues

name: Shamonte Lanfair
text: Greatest Obgyn in the state of Alabama.

name: shelley smith
text: Best in Birmingham!! I wouldn't go anywhere else.

name: LaTasha Williams
text: Dr. Bixler is an AMAZING physician! She’s so patient, so kind, knowledgeable, and makes you feel very comfortable throughout your visit, I am so happy to have her as my physician. I highly recommend her! The office staff and nurses are also very nice.

name: Ashley Touart Judice
text:
After having trouble conceiving and not having a great experience during that time with my current obgyn, I made sure that I did my research and due diligence on local doctors so that I felt like I had the best handling my much wanted and awaited for pregnancy.

Dr. Bixler has not disappointed. Unfortunately, my pregnancy has not been without complications, but she has been thorough and proactive at every step, referring me to specialists, making sure all of my concerns were heard, consistently checking on me and my baby, and even going through my testing and then discussing ACOG best practices with me as things have progressed.

I absolutely love her and trust that she is making informed decisions that are up-to-date with current best practices and balancing mine and my baby's health. If I decide to try to have another baby, I will absolutely be using her again and would recommend her to anyone.

name: Caylee Summerford
text: My experience with Dr. Bixler is by far the best I have had with any physician. She is personable, knowledgeable, and an all around great person. This is the one doctors visit I do not dread, and given the nature of obstetrics/gynecology that is saying a lot. I wish everyone could have a doctor like Dr. Quin Bixler.

resp.text: You are so kind! Thank you for sharing Caylee!

name: Kayla Mccorvey
text: I absolutely loveeeee Dr.Quin. I just recently moved to AL & she is the best doctor I have ever seen! She is friendly, genuine, and very informative. She takes the time to address every issue-which I love. I immediately felt like I could open up to her and she is now helping me deal with anxiety that I have been too afraid to speak about with anyone for years. Also, her nurse Ms.Susie is very friendly & made me feel comfortable as soon as we walked to the back. Thank you ALL for everything you do!!

name: Lexy Mooney
text: I really like Dr. Bixler. She explains everything she does and why she does it. She addresses each concern I have and makes sure that I have an answer. She's very kind and personable.

name: Mamie Harris
text: The absolute best. great bed side manner and her compassion for her patients is outstanding i am very comfortable with her.she's heaven sent

name: Niki McMullen
text: I switched to Dr. Bixler from a doctor that I felt did not address any of my concerns or have any bedside manners. Dr. Bixler is very patient, informative, and intelligent and a huge supporter of natural birth. She helped me with my anxiety tremendously and was always friendly. Unfortunately Dr. Bixler was not on call when I had my baby and the situation was very traumatic and stressful for me. I know if she had been there I would’ve been a lot more calm. Her nurses are amazing and are always quick to give you a call back. I recommend Dr. Bixler to everyone searching for an OBGYN.

name: Ebony Conley
text: Dr. Bixler is amazing. She is very attentive and thorough! She has been my ob-gyn for the past two years and is currently guiding me through my high risk pregnancy. She shows genuine care and concern for her patients, and is truly one of a kind! I am very thankful to have found her!

name: Rondarion Norwood
text: Dr. Bixler is so kind and she's such a good kind hearted person. Love her

name: Patricia Milne
text: Dr. Quin Bixler, is a wonderful DR. I'm so thankful I found her and she has been a blessing to me. I'm so thankful she performed my hysterectomy and she is so understanding .. and I know I have a second chance of enjoying the rest of my life, without the pain i endured for years. Dr. Bixler is my HERO.❤

name: Nhi Hoang
text: Come to find out, the night day before I had to go meet Dr. Bixler, my now Gynocologist. Not only she was nominated for the best Gyno in Mobile but she won the Nappie's Award for "Best Hooha Doctor". So happy to be seen by her today, she was very sweet, easy going & compassionate. She has great bedside manners and overall just easy to talk to. She was able to answers all my questions and make sure I had everything I needed before leaving. The environment was welcoming and everyone was kind. I will definitely recommend my family and friends to her! 🙂

name: Bridgette Ammons
text: Dr. Bixler did not address any of my concerns. From an outward appearance, the office seemed to be clean, neat, and organized. The front personnel was very kind and professional. They even had a form to fill out that gave them your personal history and current concerns. After I finished filling out paperwork, I asked the front desk personnel if I could go ahead and relieve myself and give them a urine sample due to the fact that I believed I had a urine infection. They said ok, showed me the way and I did the usual sample in a cup through a lab window. Being called back to the office was pleasant because they did not insist I get undressed and prepped immediately so that I could meet the Doctor for the first time and get to know her and discuss things with her. She did come in with a smile on her face and introduced herself although she only looked down at the paperwork I filled out and flipped through it as quickly as possible as if she was reviewing it then only asked me my husbands' name and how long we had been married as well as where I worked. She left me to prepare and was gentle but did not address any other issues on the not one, but two pieces of paper I had to fill out while in the waiting room. For instance, the only thing she asked was what kind of birth control I used to be on and wrote me a prescription for something completely different after I told her it worked well... then when I told her I had been diagnosed with hypothyroidism when I was 18, she told me she would do blood work and left the room. I proceeded to get dressed and they walked me to the lab where there were two other ladies who just sat there talking as I waited. After about 10-15 minutes, one of the ladies got up to go find the nurse who drew my blood. They threw away my urine sample and did not test it for a bladder infection/UTI as well as called me and told me that I did not need my thyroid medication because my TSH levels looked fine. So I received a different birth control I have never used before, zero antibiotics for my bladder/UTi infection and they believe I magically grew out of hypothyroidism because they tested my tsh levels for the pituitary response which had nothing to do with my T3 and T4 levels that I needed tested for my thyroid. Then, they found a knot in my breast and just made an appointment for me without even asking when I could come in and today when I called to ask them what building and floor I needed to be on for that appointment, they were not even open. They made an appointment for me at 8 and I'm the recording that i was given, it said they did not even open until 9 and tried to redirect me to an emergency number. I am extremely displeased with who was supposed to be the Nappie nominated "best hoo ha Dr." I would not recommend her for anything.

name: Ursala Cross
text: I am new to the area and wanted to find a doctor that I could trust to facilitate my annual women's exam. Dr. Bixler deserves an oscar for her warmth, knowledge, compassion and overall embrace. I have been to a few other doctors in my lifetime as I've lived in different places, but hands down, Dr. Bixler is one of the reason's I want to stay in Mobile, and never leave. It is extremely difficult to find a doctor who's attentive and understands the fear and uncomfortability any woman faces during these exams. While I do not have children, when I do, I plan to have Dr. Bixler guide me through the entire journey. People like Dr. Bixler are very rare and to have stumbled upon a jewel as such, is truly rewarding. She deserves the highest honor, the highest ratings and all the beautiful things this life has to offer. Her bedside manner is bar none and her demeanor makes you feel incredibly at ease during such a rough time for some women. I will never visit another Obgyn. She will forever by my Obgyn. Honestly, if you are struggling to find a doctor who cares and understands the importance of compassion, humility, human decency and respect, I strongly encourage you to consider becoming a patient of Dr. Bixler. God bless you, Dr. Bixler. May he bless your life forever.

name: Wanda Bennett
text: The best ever she is such a doll and I was so at ease with her

name: Stacy Taylor
text: We love Dr. Bixler!

name: Jordan Jarvis Hughes
text: Dr. Parnell and the entire staff were so compassionate & knowledgeable. He figured out what was going on with me when other doctors couldn’t! The entire experience was wonderful-each person I interacted with in the office was so kind and really took the time to listen and validate what I was going through. My life was changed for the better after visiting this office and starting my healing journey, and for that I am forever grateful! I HIGHLY recommend Dr. Parnell!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind review and we are so happy to help!

name: Emily massey
text: Dr. Parnell and his staff are truly one of a kind. It’s refreshing to step into an office where you feel heard and cared for. He is extremely knowledgeable in his specialty and an excellent surgeon. I trust that his opinion is in my best interest, and with that, I am thankful to have found him and his team at Brookwood.

resp.text: Thank you so much Emily, it is an honor and a joy to serve women!

name: Brandy Spears
text:
Dr. Parnell and his staff are incredible. They’re compassionate and caring. Plus, OB/GYN South is on the cutting edge of technology.  I have lost count the surgeries I have had prior to seeing Dr. Parnell, and he has fixed me. I thought that I was unfixable.
It’s no exaggeration the he and his staff are the best in the business. And, I truly can’t thank them enough.

resp.text: Thank you so much Brandy.  We are thankful to be able to take care of you!

name: Linda Burke
text: Dr. Parnell and his staff are so compassionate, kind, and friendly. He is an excellent doctor and surgeon!  He knew immediately what to do to help me when no one else did. The solution was an Axonics SNM System to regulate my bladder. I highly recommend him and this device!  It was life changing!

resp.text: Thank you so much!  We love taking care of you, it is a privilege

name: denise wheeler
text: It brings tears to my eyes when I try to explain what Dr. Parnell has done for me. He installed a bladder stimulator and bladder mesh. Life changing! If you are having any bladder issues I highly recommend Dr. Parnell.

resp.text: That is so kind, thank you!

name: Anna Theisen
text: Dr. Parnell is absolutely amazing. Staff is kind and friendly. I had a previous bladder stimulator that was over 8 years old. Dr. Parnell got me into surgery fast and was able to replace it will a new Axonics stimulator! I am so thankful for him and he has done for me!

resp.text: Thank you so much Anna!  It is a privilege

name: Rich Pennino
text: Dr. Parnell, Francie Barnes, and the entire staff are fantastic. You or your family member will have a great experience with this UROGYNECOLOGY office.

resp.text: Thank you so much, we are very thankful for your kind review

name: Joy DeZearn-Allen
text: Dr. Parnell is absolutely one of my favorite doctors ever!  He and his staff are so caring and very easy to talk to about anything.  I started having bladder problems and being only in my 40’s I needed a treatment plan that did not include wearing incontinence underwear on a daily basis.  After an examination, some tests and a prescription trial we decided that a Sacral Neuromodulation Implant surgery would be the best option for me.  The procedure was outpatient and there was no pain involved and recovery time was minimal.  I have the Axonics System, the small Neurostimulator implant is just slightly bigger than a quarter.  Charging  the battery is no problem at all and the remote has only 3 buttons.  Setting up the programs are easy to do, I worked with Rich who is one of the representatives for Axonics and he was such an important part for my whole process.  He would send me texts to make sure my programs were working.  The only thing I regret is not having done this sooner.  It gave me my the confidence to leave the house.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing joy!  We are thankful to be a part of your story!

name: Trish Green
text: Love this doctor and staff. Very helpful and they explain everything.  Make you feel comfortable.

resp.text: Thank you so much Trish!

name: Patton Short
text: Dr. Parnell is not only highly educated and personable, his surgical skill is unmatched! Would rate 12/10.

resp.text: Thanks you so much Patton!

name: Jennifer Awwad
text: Dr. Frazier was such a warm welcome from my previous OBGYN. She took time to discuss things. Her demeanor was more of a caring friend. I really appreciate all the different options and medical advice she gave. Great experience.

name: Tiffany Alstatt
text: I have been having several issues going on for awhile. I’ve went to other OBGYNS for advice and options and no one really wanted to put in the time. Dr. Frazier has took her time and has worked with me to find out what I need for me. I had heard mixed reviews when I first went but I’m extremely pleased and happy with how she has handled me, understood me and offered more than one option to try and get me on track.

name: Debra Evans
text: I have been seeing Dr. Frazier for the past two years. She is very knowledgeable and nice. Her staff are great too

name: JoAnna Goggans
text: I've used Dr. Frazier for many years. She delivered my daughter. I have never had anything other than a pleasant experience at her office. The nurses have always been kind and Dr. Frazier has always been a caring and efficient doctor.

name: Millard Willmore
text: Office staff and everyone else I came in contact with were great. However, the doctor was horrible. I had to tell her multiple times to stop a procedure she was doing on me. I feel truly sorry for anyone at this woman’s mercy when they are most vulnerable.

name: Vonnie Dunn
text: I must say that I have been completely satisfied with her n I feel she listens to my complaint n always asks if there is anything I had concerns about... I definitely would recommend her...

name: Magan Dingler
text: I've been going to Dr Frazier for probably 8 or 9 years. She delivered my son. She is an excellent doctor and i recommend her to everyone.

name: cheryl clark
text: I can't honestly say how I would feel about Dr. Fraizer.   I didn't get past her very rude nurse Jenifer.  After being referred to Dr. Fraizer by her sister-in-law, Inkyung Santiago, I ask Jennifer why I'd been referred.  She told me she had no idea, this after being treated as if I were invisible thought out the intake, and the gum popping, was almost too much.  After sitting and waiting and being given time to think, I left the office. On my way out Dr. Fraizer offered another nurse, but it was just a bad situation all the way around.  I will go somewhere else for a mammogram after this.

name: Katie Faga
text: I had a textbook, perfect, healthy pregnancy. Dr hurd gave me an ultrasound at 36 weeks (which I later found out isnt even necessary) and saw that baby looked small. He immediately decided he was going to induce me not even a week later. He never presented it as a choice or listened to my concerns. He ordered 1 additional stress test (no additional ultrasound or anything) and everything came back perfect and normal. Regardless, he went ahead with inducing me. Baby came out 3 lbs heavier than what he guessed. But struggled for weeks with the affects of being induced early, and made the birth traumatic for me as well. He mentioned being induced several times earlier in my pregnancy and knew it was against my wishes. Not only was he grossly incorrect in medicine, but he was insensitive, rude, and unkind. His choice of conversation not even 1 minute after birth was what birth control he was giving me in 6 weeks. He was LATE to my very active labor. At my 6 werks checkup he invited 2 other college students to watch me have an IUD inserted without even asking my permission to such a private appointment. All around a terrible doctor. Protect this sacred moment in your life and find someone better! I wish I had!

name: Courtney Bunt
text: Dr. Hurd is an excellent doctor and a skilled surgeon. When I first moved to the area, he came highly recommended. I've been seeing him for 5 years and he delivered my youngest via c-section, and more recently performed a partial hysterectomy on me in which he left one single tiny scar above my belly button. Just one! I have been impressed by his knowledge and expertise, his kindness and friendliness, and his bedside manner.

name: Joshua Miller
text: My wife was having contractions every 5 minutes for over 30 hours straight. She is considered high-risk because her last pregnancy ended in an emergency C section. We went to the hospital three times over two nights, each time begging to either be admitted or at least to be sent home with something for the pain or to help her sleep. Each time, Dr. Hurd told us with indifference, he would do nothing for us, to go home. I will tell everyone I can to never use Dr. Hurd.

name: Genna rogerson
text:
Let me start off by saying this is the first review I have ever submitted.

Eastern Ob Gyn fit me into their schedule w/ Dr. Pruitt today due to my discomfort from an 8cm ovarian cyst. I was seen in the ER and admitted to UAB Medical West in Bessemer this past weekend by Dr. Stephens. After I was discharged, I began to have unpleasant symptoms of nausea. I called Dr. Stephen and Dr. Gills office (Medical West) 2-3 times and left a message with the nurse to call me back..I never received a call back.

I cannot thank Dr. Pruitt's office enough for fitting me in so quickly. Dr. Pruitt made me feel so comfortable and at easy (which meant the world to me due to the lack of care I got from Medical West Ob/Gyn). I am 25 and recently moved from North Carolina and have no family here, so as you can imagine, all of this was scary to me. I want to thank Dr. Pruitt and his staff for picking up the slack from my prior Ob/Gyn. He truly is the best doctor and I will recommend him to anyone!

name: Lesa Crumpler
text: I have been an established patient at this office for more than 18 yrs. Dr. Pruitt is great to see for yearly visits, acts like he is a truly concerned doctor but you find out what he’s really like when you have an emergency. He throws you off on a nurse practitioner when you have an urgent need. His nurse is also very rude and hard to deal with...and she lied to me. Sad and extremely disappointed.

name: Katresa Larry
text: I haven't seen Dr. Pruitt since my last pregnancy in 2009. Dr. Pruitt always seemed to be laughing or smiling when I went for my check up. I hope I made his day, lol. It's been a while, lol. My experience with Dr. Pruitt and his his staff was awesome. He encouraged me to gain weight. I am 5 feet and weighed 120  lbs at the time. Every time I saw my doctor, he would say you need to put more weight on. And I would say I'm trying doctor, lol. At the end I was weighing almost 150 lbs. My son decided to stay inside me for two weeks after his due date. Dr.  Pruitt had I had a difference of opinions about waiting after my due date. I wanted him to schedule a date and Dr. Pruitt wanted to wait. He said as long as I was healthy, then he can stay inside me. Of course I didn't want to hear that messed, lol. We waited and by the time he said let's schedule a date and I was got in assigned room and was waiting on someone to induced my labor, my son decided to come.  Then Dr. Pruitt came into my room smiling that morning and said, see he came right on time, lol. So I had a little complications during my labor and Dr. Pruitt said we need to do a c-section because my hips are narrow and they didn't expand . So I told him I didn't want to scar and he said my son was in distressed, so long story short ,lol, my son, Jaxon, has arrived. He was a big baby.  My scar is small and barely noticeable. So thank you for that Dr. Pruitt.

resp.text: Thank you very much for your kind comments!

He's all tied up with a board meeting. We have to re-schedule." again!!! I went immediately  got my records and am never going back. Three months of my life tied up waiting for this man.  Someone should tell him that   M.D.       DOES NOT STAND FOR MEDICAL DEITY!!

text: Dr. Pearson is wonderful. She came recommended by my mom and she has helped me every step of the way with my decision to change from the pill

text:
I have always found the staff and physicians at Southern Women's Specialist to be caring and extremely professional.  The professional
staff is top notch. I wouldn't dream of going anywhere else.

name: Stephanie Harper
text: Dr. Guepet took phenomenal care of me when I was experiencing menstrual problems post endometrial ablation from a previous GYN. She takes time to listen and investigate, then collaborate with you to find the most suitable option. For me, it was a hysterectomy. I could not be happier with the care that I received from her. She was very informative both preop and postop and has the calmest disposition that goes such a long way at the bedside. I highly recommend her if you are looking for a GYN doctor :)

name: Melody Faith
text: Staff and office are both lovely and welcoming, they're fantastic with very fast wait times and are all very nice.  I love seeing Dr. Pearson and highly recommend her, she really listens and answers any questions well

name: Dwanda Schwarz
text:
edit : Their sign up process is long, and you have to complete this before they will set up an appointment. I spent an hour completing their forms just for them to say that though they had my insurance prior to requesting me to complete their long set up process, they would not set me up an appointment with my insurance company which they admitted they accept. They said they would set me up as cash pay but would not attempt to charge my insurance company unless I selected a primary which I had been unable to do due to covid and no local drs taking new patients or their waiting list was 8 months out.
I called my insurance company to ask about options, they said since I had PPO coverage I did not have to select a primary to receive coverage and they would pay for my womans care. My insurance company conferenced called this clinic to tell them the service would be covered, but the lady continued to admit she did not know how to read the coverage, so the insurance lady read it to her very kindly three times. The clerk continued to say she was setting me up as cash pay instead of charging my insurance for my own benefit because she wanted to help me.
The insurance agent and I both very confused asked what that meant. (All on a recorded line that I have).
The SWS clerk said she just wasnt sure and would have to get management, instead of her going to get her manager so we could clarify this and get my appointment set up, the SWS clerk hung up.
After spending an entire day trying to set up an appointment with this clinic, I called the one in Mobile with a 4.9 stars and they had my appointment for next week set in under 10 minutes. I got off the phone bewildered how easy setting up my appointment was at the MOBILE CLINIC.

I called hoping to make them my regular womans care doctor because of the reviews. Due to just receiving a new medical package this year I had no previous primary care physician in this county. After receiving my medical package after COVID I had called around to set an appt for primary care physician origination, but due to recent times, either no one was accepting new patients or were 8 months out for initial appointment. so currently none set up. When I called here they had me fill out their online documents which took over an hour and even requested my credit card information to be held on file, which I did. Then I called happy and excited to set up my appointment now that all the paperwork was complete.
They told me they would not give me an appointment until I picked out a primary car physician. So I called my PPO Blue Cross Blue Shield policy and they advised me that I am still covered for service, I am just not eligible for the $10 co-pay discount but all other services are still covered the same, so we called the clinic back but the lady continued to argue with my insurance company saying I was not covered. My insurance company repeated, "WE WILL PAY HER SERVICES, SHE JUST DOES NOT GET THE DISCOUNT." but the receptionist could not understand this and said she would have to get her manager. but instead of getting her manager she just hung up. After spending an entire day trying to set up an appointment with this clinic, I called the one in Mobile with a 4.9 stars and they had my appointment for next week set in under 10 minutes. I got off the phone bewildered how easy setting up my appointment was at the MOBILE CLINIC.

name: Constance Rawlins
text: Since moving to the Gulf Coast several years ago, it had been several years since I saw a gynecologist. I am now in my 60s so I had some age-related gyneocology issues. A friend recommended Dr. Angela McCool Pearson. An office visit with Dr. Pearson is like having coffee with a girlfriend. It's easy to talk with her about personal issues. Following Dr. Pearson's protocol, my personal issues improved. Dr. Pearson tweaked the protocol on my followup visit. It's great having a female gynecologist that can relate to issues that women have. In the past, most of my gynecologists were male.

name: Kimberly Blake
text: Kind, professional, upbeat, friendly and made me feel so comfortable! Love Dr. Pearson and her entire staff!! Great group of women!

name: Jenny Bramblett
text: Dr. Guepet and staff are top-notch professionals. Incredibly knowledgeable, innovative and kind would be the most accurate way to describe this office. I always feel taken care and they educate you about what is best so you can make an informed decision. I highly recommend them.

name: Lucy Haynes
text: I had a terrible experience at my last gynecologist. Kept me from going to get check ups for years. I had a friend recommended Dr. Pearson and I am SO glad she did! This office was very nice, clean, and everyone was super friendly and professional. Dr. Pearson took the time to listen to what I had to say and addressed each topic. And I was in and out in no time! She will be my preferred Dr. now on!

name: Beth Reece
text: I had my first GYN appointment at Southern Women's Specialist today and was extremely pleased with the experience. The atmosphere was relaxing,, the staff friendly and Dr. Pearson was the best. She was knowledgeable and very pleasant and made me feel more than just a number. I highly recommend her!!

name: Jaime Gottlieb
text: I have known Angie McCool-Pearson for almost 20 years.  She had delivered both my daughters (one a miracle), We cried and hugged as they were born.  Dr. Pearson is not only a wonderful professional, who graduated top of her class, and considered one of the best physicians in South Alabama, but I consider her a beautiful friend.

name: Amanda Alexander
text: Dr. Guepet and Dr. Pearson are two of the VERY BEST providers! They both are very caring and always willing to go above and beyond to help anyone that they can. My experience is always very pleasant and I will always refer people to this practice! If you need a GYN doc this is the place to be!

name: Joan McDonald
text:
I have finally found the best doctor ever since moving to Gulf Shores, AL! I have lived here now 3 years;  and have searched and searched for a doctor here, instead of having to go back to Marietta, GA to my long-time gynecologist! Well I found her, Dr. Angela Pearson in Fairhope, AL!
I have had some very serious issues from prior female surgeries, and Dr. Pearson was willing and able to address them with no hesitation! I can’t thank her enough for taking me as her patient, and ready to help me get back to a normal active lifestyle!  Thank you God for Dr. Angela Pearson!

name: Beth K
text: Warm inviting environment. Very friendly and knowledgable staff. Communicate well. Phone messages are returned in a timely manner. You know that they are concerned about your well-being and provide excellent medical care. I am very happy to have found Dr. McCool-Pearson and her staff!

text: Although, I don't relish going to the doctor, I know when it is time to see Dr. Pearson, I will always be treated respectfully and professionally and seen in a timely manner. text: Dr brown is very knowledgable and is real personal. I would recommend him definitely

name: Kathy Dupre
text: In my 68 years I have seen a number of doctors. Dr Brown is by far the best one yet. Women's issues are often not acknowledged by doctors. I know I'm not the only woman to hear "well, it's just that time of the month ".  Or "you know, at your age ". More than once I have wanted to scream ARE YOU LISTENING?  I've never felt that way with Dr Brown. He DOES listen. He listens so well that he was able to tell me I had an infected kidney stone when my urologist couldn't figure it out. He has such a kind gentle nature you just want to hug him. Oh, and the ladies in the office are wonderful as well.

name: Albert Sophie
text: New to the area, I selected Dr. Guepet as my new GYN. I had an annual wellness exam, as well as a mammogram and bone density test. Dr. Guepet asked me to set up a follow-up appt to receive the results of the mammogram and bone density. At no time was I told this would be my financial responsibility. I have never had to have two exams for my annual check-up until now. If I had a problem and needed to come back for a follow-up, that I would understand. To receive the results of the tests done, and they were normal, no more than ten minutes, I had to come back to see Dr. Guepet in person at her request.  I even asked the desk clerk on my way out if I owed anything, and I was told no. Then the bill comes, $170.00 billed to insurance as an outpatient; over $100 billed to me. I would have rather picked up the results or received them over the phone, but Dr. Guepet doesn't do that. The office was not forthcoming, and if the Practice Manager, Wendy, does not want to hear back from customers like me, than they had better be forthcoming with this second exam as the customer's financial responsibility. For all the years I have had gynecological exams, I have never needed two appointments for one annual check-up. I canceled my next exam and will no longer use this practice for my GYN needs.

text: First 2 times I came for an appointment and they made me wait an hour, 3rd time I tried to go I came about 8 minutes late and told me I had to reschedule. When I had bad side effects with the birth control prescribed I told the doctor and they seemed like they were waiting on me to tell them what to do. I was hoping to get some guidance and education on why I was having these bad side effects and what I should switch to but they were no help. They just prescribed me another type and nothing changed. I still have these side effects and I don’t know why. I wish the doctor would have helped me out more.

name: Penn2walk
text: The 1st time was pleasant. The 2nd trip, I waited an hour with no explanation. It's very inconsiderate of people's time.

name: Sara Astle
text: Last year, I was having issues for 5 months. After about 3 months, Dr. Robinson FINALLY decided that she should do a biopsy "so that she didn't look like a bad doctor" (her words) and an ultrasound. Those results didn't show anything so she talked me into have a ablation instead of a hysterectomy like I asked. During the ablation, she shoved a tool through my uterus causing a hole and subsequent fluid leakage into my abdomen. Not only did I wake up without an ablation, but also three incisions in my belly where she had to cut me to get the fluid out. I fired her after that and had another doc do my hysterectomy.

name: Leilani Jackson
text: I promise, since I was 14 I have struggled to find an OBGYN that I felt actually cared and listened. I have been terrified of going to medical professionals because of the lack of attention, care and seemingly knowledge. Dr. Willams, the receptionist staff and even the decor made me feel so safe and comfortable. I wasn't scared to give complete detail, I didn't have to downplay my pain. I didn't have to repeat my symptoms or hurt. I smiled the whole time. Unlike the local ER my pap smear was painless. They ran the same test I asked for from Crestwood and found the problem. (it's great when you listen to your body and your doctor does as well) I've literally cried tears of joy. I've been extremely ill since June and after seeing Dr. Willams I've felt better each day. Thank you so, so, so much!

text: I'm currently pregnant with twins. My grandfather passed away on the day of my first appointment. I wrote through the portal to let the staff know why I missed my appointment. I should have known not to go BK to them after the uneasy feeling I got during my last pregnancy when my concerns were minimized.

resp.text: Sorry to hear about the passing of your grandfather. May you and your family find comfort and peace. Congratulations in advance for a healthy, uneventful delivery with your twins. Hopefully, this gives you the opportunity to find care with a practitioner whose care model is more closely aligned with yours. Physicians have the right to dismiss patients for various reasons. Patients have the right to receive care from a provider they are not "uneasy" with.  Doctors and patients work together as a team. It is important to find the right match in order to obtain the best outcomes. Your feedback is important.

name: Kala McClendon
text: Dr. Robinson is wonderful! I love her gorgeous purple office! The walls are a shrine to beautiful babies delivered by Dr. Robinson. Everyone is so friendly in her office. Sometimes you do have to wait, but at least it feels like you're waiting at home! All of my wishes were honored. Any note, form, or test needing completed staff were very attentive to. I broke down once on Dr. Robinson while I was pregnant. She was so encouraging and uplifting. The way I feel about medicine, is that it takes guesswork, with common sense, and knowledge. Dr. Robinson has an ability to use all 3 of those, and a great bedside manner. The nurses at the hospital tell me that Dr. Robinson hardly ever does a cesarean delivery. The lowest rate at the hospital I'm told. While very necessary in my case, I know it was only done because there wasn't another option. I have a happy, healthy, living baby boy because of this decision. Big praise to some of my favorite people in the office,  Greg, Lonnie, and my friend with the M name (I'm really bad with names. I had 9 months to learn theirs.) My M name lady, she has really pretty hair, and nails, you'll be able to spot her. I enjoyed all the great people here! I do not enjoy the protesters, but they're certainly a little crazy. They're protesting a clinic that doesn't do abortions at this location. Head coocoo with the white hair, and big sign is only scary because of her chicken squawk the first 2 times, or so. If you see people outside protesting, be careful, because you want to give idiots the right to live. Don't run over her. Remember, choose to let her continue her miserable life. Make your own decisions about your body, and be grateful we're able! Also, read Dr. Robinson's accomplishments. Incredible lady!

resp.text: Thank you so much!!! We truly enjoy taking care of you. We are honored that you chose AWWC to help welcome your little one into the world! Congratulations, again!!!!

name: Spiffy Pumpkin
text:
I'll open with this; I've always suffered from horrible periods (that have only gotten worse as I got older) Dr.Robinson said, "Oh if you lose thirty pounds it'll ease up." Five pounds lighter and my periods had actually gotten worse instead of better, to the point where I would be bedridden for a day or so every month and unable to work out like I usually do for a week or so. So I went somewhere else for my yearly exam this time, hoping for real help. (She was my first gyno visit, I wasn't sure then if this was just how these appointments are.) My new doctor examined me without causing additional pain like Dr.Robinson did, she was so rough during my examination and she acted like I was being oversensitive! She applied so much pressure on my ovaries during the exam that they felt bruised the next day. My new doctor put my fears of birth control pills at ease instead of treating me like I was being over-paranoid and put me on one that made it so I can live normally even during my period! (I can go to the gym during it now!)

Ultimately she belittled my concerns, made me feel as though my suffering was my fault (even though I tried to tell her I've been fit before, I've previously been on a track team and swim team simultaneously, back then my periods caused black-out, light-headedness, plus some of my other problems) and then did nothing to resolve a problem that had plagued me for years. I'd recommend going literally anywhere else now that I know that a gyno appointment doesn't have to be like that one was.

resp.text: We are so sorry that you were not happy with your care. Our goal is to provide evidence based medical care that aligns with the best medical opinion of our providers and the goals of our patients. Thank you for your comments. We are glad to know that you found the help you need.

name: Moon & Ash
text:
I never got to speak or meet with Dr. Campbell, so this review is more for the practice in general. This is my first pregnancy and I needed a new doctor, my previous doctor having recently moved out of state. Unfortunately, it was very difficult to get in touch with anyone at this practice.

No one answered when I tried to schedule an appointment, and no one returned my call when I left a message. When I finally did get to speak to a person and got an appointment made, I asked to be put through to the nurse as I had a concern. The receptionist forgot to send me through, hanging up instead. So I called again and left a message for the nurse, explaining that my concern was time-sensitive (I needed an answer before the next morning) and also explaining that I was making a long drive out of town and to please leave a message addressing my concern if I'm unable to answer. The nurse called me back about 8 hours later and, still driving, I missed the call. Instead of addressing my concerns, the message simply said to call them back. I did, just 6 short minutes after the missed call, only to receive an automated message that they were closed and would charge me $25 to speak to someone if they deemed my problem not urgent. I needed an answer to my concern before they would be open the next morning, so there I was, out of town, first time pregnant, hormonal, and sobbing to my poor SO because I wasn't sure the right thing to do to keep our baby safe. Sweet SO ended up contacting his mother, a nurse, who consulted a doctor she works with, and I was finally able to put my mind at ease.

I understand doctor's offices are busy, but the result is that I felt unimportant and uncared for, and I have cancelled my appointment and found another practice with which to entrust my pregnancy.

name: Aereal Runyans
text: I recently switched over to Dr. Campbell when I found out I was pregnant with my first child. I have been so pleased with the switch. Dr. Campbell has excellent bedside manner. She is easy to talk to. I feel totally confident in her skill and abilities. I definitely recommend her!

resp.text: Ms. Runyans, thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to Dr. Campbell and her team. Your recommendation means so much to us and we're so happy to have earned it. Thank you again for taking the time to share your positive experience. Have a great day!

name: Ola L
text:
I had a wonderful experience with Dr. Campbell during my whole pregnancy and birthing experience. She listened to everything I said and actually worked with me in a way I don't think other doctors would have. She is laid back and very easy to talk to. She is definitely a doctor I would recommend to anyone for pregnancy OR just general women's health.
A++ doctor!!!!

name: Niki Green
text: The best MD I know.....she is very compassionate and always listens! She never makes you feel like your not important! I have followed her since she was in Alabaster

name: Jay Donaldson
text: extremely kind and very intelligent

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review!

name: Elizabeth Spence
text: Absolutely love her, she has been my doctor for years I would never go to any other doctor. So very sweet and intelligent, she knows what she's talking about and actually listens to you.

name: Mikhail Kozorovitskiy
text: Dr maybe good but waiting an hour and a half past appointment time when we arrived on time is not.

name: Angela Glassford
text: Absolutely the best bedside manner you could ever receive from a doctor. I wouldn't want anyone else to delivery my children.
